item.description: Big Noddy is the project name of UK hard house producer Digger.

item.title: Bando – Chavalas A Punta Pala EP
item.description: Manuel Rio, also known as Bando, is a Spanish DJ and producer who has been active since the early 1990s. He is characterized by an energetic style with a tribal feel, based on techno, and rich in percussion and groove, and has created remixes for Ben Sims, Marco Bailey, DJ Misjah, Cristian Varela, and more. As a DJ, he is a resident with Cristian Varela, who is active worldwide and has won the Best Techno DJ award, and has performed in various countries including touring not only in Europe but also in the US and Asia.

item.title: Baby Ford – Children Of The Revolution
item.description: Peter Frank Adshead, also known as Baby Ford, is a British electronic music producer known for contributing to the birth of acid house. The club track Oochy Koochy (F.U. Baby Yeah Yeah), released in 1988, is considered the first UK acid house record to hit the UK Singles Chart.

item.title: Arthur Baker Vs Rennie Pilgrem – Like No Other (Remixes)
item.description: Arthur Baker is a Hip Hop and Electro pioneer known for his collaborations with Afrika Bambaataa, Planet Patrol, and New Order.

item.description: Miraculous encounter “Eurobeat x Parapara”

item.description: Dummy Run is an experimental electro duo by Andrew Sharpley and Nick Birmingham.

item.description: Memories of speed where anime and music intersect

item.title: Bent – ​​Stay The Same
item.description: Bent is an electronica and downtempo duo from the UK who were active from 1999 to 2009 and reunited in 2019. The members are Simon Mills and Neil Tolliday. Their style is characterized by a mix of sampling and humor, and they were active in the downtempo scene of the early 2000s.

item.title: Adam F feat. Redman – Smash Sumthin (Remixes)
item.description: A remix of drum”n”bass/hip-hop producer Adam F’s single “Smash Sumthin” (2001), released in 2002 on the label Kaos Recordings.

item.description: A UK alternative rock band related to shoegaze and Britpop that was active from 1988 to 1999 and reunited in 2021.

item.title: Captain Jack – Together And Forever!
item.description: Captain Jack is a dance project from Cologne, Germany that represents the Eurodance scene of the 90s. The initial members were producers Udo Niebergall and Richard Witte. A party maker who headlined every famous festival in the 90s.

item.title: Anthill Mob – You Should Have Known
item.description: Anthill Mob is a UK garage group representing East London.

item.title: Ant – K.O. Computer
item.description: Anthony Wilson, also known as Ant and Chicago Loop, is a techno DJ and producer based in London, England. He has released on numerous labels such as Phobiq, Gate null recordings, and Renesanz.

item.description: Alexia is a singer from Italy. She also works under her real name, Alessia Aquilani, and Alexia Cooper.

item.description: Kid Creole And The Coconuts is an American group started by August Darnell with Andy Hernandez & Adriana Kaegi. His style is a mix of disco, Latin, Caribbean, and Callaway style elements.

item.title: Hamel & Blackwatch – Discotek
item.description: Bill Hamel, also known as Hamel, is a record producer and remixer known as a founding member of the US trance group Fatum. He has been nominated for a Grammy Award for his remix work. Michael Thomas, also known as Blackwatch, is a progressive house producer.

item.title: Deadmau5 – The Reward Is Cheese Not Exactly
item.description: Joel Thomas Zimmerman, also known as Deadmau5, is a Canadian DJ and producer. His works under the name Deadmau5 are characterized by a style that is a mix of Progressive House and Electro House. He has been nominated for six Grammy Awards so far.

item.title: Timo Maas – Music For The Maases
item.description: Timo Maas is a legendary German DJ, producer, and remixer who has been active since the 1990s. He has played at famous clubs and festivals in Japan and abroad, including Ibiza”s DC10 and Berlin”s Tresor, and in 2008 he launched his own label Rockets & Ponies, releasing works by artists such as Wolfgang Haffner, Ricardo Villalobos, Maetrik, Nightmares on Wax, and Addison Groove.

item.title: Teena Marie – It Must Be Magic
item.description: Teena Marie, also known as Lady T, is an American soul and R&B singer. She has a unique and soulful soprano vocal style.

item.description: "”A remarkable group of Euro music pieces filled with sophisticated melodies and a sense of dynamism that excites the dance floor.’’

item.title: EBE – Aural Allusions EP
item.description: Lucas Rodenbush, also known as EBE, is an American electronic musician based in San Jose. He has released on various famous labels such as Transmat, Soma, Plastic City, Greyhound, Afterhours, Resource Records, Jump Recordings, and Organized Noise. Other names include Entity and Moonchild.

item.description: The golden age of UK techno: a record of the sounds and struggles of the 1990s

item.title: Cecil Parker – Dance Everybody
item.description: Cecil Parker is a four-octave vocalist and songwriter from Philadelphia.

item.title: Brennan Green – 900lb Man
item.description: Brennan Green is a veteran NY underground disco/electro DJ, producer, and engineer. He is also known as a person who influenced Metro Area and the label DFA, and is also famous for producing remixes of Kid Creole & The Coconuts and ARTHUR RUSSELL tribute band ARTHUR’S LANDING.

item.title: Bomb The Bass – Say A Little Prayer
item.description: Timothy Simenon (Tim Simenon), also known as Bomb The Bass, is a major figure in the UK electronic music scene who contributed to the acid house scene of the late 1980s. He is best known for his masterpiece “Beat Dis”.

item.title: Akimbo Featuring Marcina Arnold – Everybody Knows
item.description: Akimbo is a funk/soul rock band that includes guitarist Simon Bartholomew of the UK funk/acid jazz band Brand New Heavies, former Jamiroquai drummer Nick van Gelder, Gareth Bailey, Nick Seymour, and Tom Bailey.

item.title: The Cage Featuring Nona Hendryx – Do What Ya Wanna Do
item.description: The Cage is a band formed mainly by Nona Hendryx, with the participation of Rusty Egan (drums), Steve Barnacle (bass/guitar), and Gary Barnacle (saxophone/synth), who were members of the British synth pop group Visage, which is famous as the birthplace of the New Romantic movement.

item.title: Luke Slater – All Exhale
item.description: “All Exhale” is a single by UK techno DJ and producer Luke Slater, released in 2000 on the label NovaMute (Mute group). The original version was included on the classic album “Wireless” released in 1999. The powerful driving techno track was a huge hit and an anthem that was frequently played in clubs.

item.title: VA – Rock"N"Roll & Rock-A-Billy Inferno
item.description: Rock”n”Roll & Rockabilly is a rockabilly compilation album released by Stardust Records in 2001.

item.title: Silent Phase – (The Theory Of)
item.description: Stacey Pullen, also known as Silent Phase, was a techno DJ and producer from Detroit who was active in the 1990s. Other names include Kosmic Messenger and Bango. This album is their only album under the name Silent Phase, and features a deep and mellow sound that mixes jazz, ambient, IDM, and techno. It has been praised as an artistic Detroit techno piece.

item.title: Arrested Development – ​​Zingalamaduni
item.description: Arrested Development is an American Afrocentric hip-hop group formed in 1988 by rappers Speech and Headliner.

item.title: Rudolf Rocker – The Exotic Sounds Of Rudolf Rocker
item.description: Rudolf Rocker is a UK situationist chamber pop ensemble band formed by Jeremy Dyson, Mark Goodall, and Steven Goodall. Jeremy Dyson, the keyboard player, is also a production member of the BBC sitcom ““The League of Gentlemen’’ and is active as a screenwriter and comedian.

item.title: Rakim – The Saga Begins
item.description: “The Saga Begins” is a single cut (bootleg version) from Rakim’s solo debut album “The 18th Letter” released in 1997. The producer is Pete Rock.

item.title: Papa Dee – Island Rock
item.description: David Christopher Daniel Wahlgren, also known as Papa Dee, is a rapper from Sweden. His style is a mix of elements of ragga, dub, dancehall, reggae, and hip hop.

item.title: Mijk Van Dijk – Glow
item.description: Mijk Van Dijk is a German techno producer and DJ who has been active since the 1990s.

item.title: Luke Slater – Freek Funk
item.description: Luke Slater is a British electronic musician, DJ, and record producer who has been active at the forefront of the techno scene since the early 1990s. Other names include Planetary Assault Systems and LSD.

item.title: Luke Slater – Alright On Top
item.description: An album released in 2002 by the label Mute, featuring vocals entirely by Ricky Barrows. The hit song “Nothing At All” is included. Tracks 11 & 12 are bonus tracks only for the Japanese version.

item.title: Latex – Encore
item.description: Michael Borrmann, also known as Latex, is a producer from Germany. He also works under the name Steril and has released on various labels including DJ Hell’s label International Deejay Gigolo Records and Lasergun.

item.title: Eclier – Boxon Say Hello
item.description: Eclier, a Siberian native who was discovered by Boxon Records director Julien Minet (aka DCFTD, DJ Cat) through SNS, is an artist known for his French electro style.

item.title: The Drug Punks – Drug Punk
item.description: “Drug/Punk” is an Electroclash, Electro House track released in 2002 by the UK label City Rockers. Producer: JJ Clam, The Wurlitzer.

item.description: Codec & Flexor is a duo consisting of German-based DJ, producer, composer, and multi-instrumentalist Sven Zalac (Codec) and German composer and producer Mathias Freund (Flexor).

item.title: Akasha Project – Always
item.description: Barnim A. Schultze, also known as Akasha Project, is a German electronic musician who has been active since the mid-1980s.

item.description: Unofficial HOUSE MIX of the famous songs The Police”s ““When The World Is Running Down” and Sting”s ““Englishman In New York.” Released in 2001.

item.description: Joris Voorn is a DJ and remixer from Amsterdam who represents the Dutch techno world.

item.description: A techno track by Guy McAffer (Geezer), a stalwart of London’s underground acid techno scene, and Lenny Dee, a House, Techno, Gabber DJ and owner of the label Industrial Strength since the 1980s.

item.title: Felipe & Nicolas Bacher – Next Destination EP
item.description: Felipe (Philipp Straub) & Nicolas Bacher (DJ Dexter) are an Austrian DJ and producer duo based in Vienna. He also works under the names Enzian and Titanium, and is the founder of the labels Titanium Records and Supreme Entertainment.

item.title: Earth, Wind & Fire – All 'N All
item.description: All ‘n All is the eighth studio album by the American band Earth, Wind & Fire, released by Columbia Records in 1977. This album is Earth, Wind & Fire’s masterpiece, reaching number 1 on the US Billboard Top R&B/Hip-Hop Albums chart.

item.title: The Nylons – Seamless
item.description: The Nylons was a Canadian a cappella group that was active from 1978 to 2017. He is best known for his pop covers such as The Turtles” ““Happy Together”, Steam”s ““Na Na Hey Hey Kiss Him Goodbye”, and The Tokens’ ““The Lion Sleeps Tonight’’.

item.title: Tangerine Dream – Thief
item.description: Original soundtrack for Michael Mann’s first film as a director (original title: Thief), released in 1981 (original title: Thief) (based on the novel by Frank Hochmer). Japanese version.

item.title: Rino Cerrone – Exact Moment EP
item.description: Rino Cerrone is an Italian techno/tech house DJ and producer based in Naples since 1990. (Death in 2024)

item.description: Steve Barnes, also known as Process, is a DJ from England. Also known as Cosmic Sandwich.

item.title: Mike Ink – Paroles
item.description: Wolfgang Voigt, also known as Mike Ink, is an electronic music DJ and producer from Cologne, Germany. In addition to Mike Ink, he is also known by various other names, including Gas, M:I:5:, and Wassermann. Since the 1990s, he has been signed to many famous record labels, including Warp, Harvest, Raster-Noton, Force Inc, and Astral Industries, and is considered one of the most influential minimal techno artists. In 1998, he co-founded the label Kompakt with Michael Mayer & Jürgen Paape.

item.title: Spirit Catcher – Voo Doo Knight
item.description: Spirit Catcher is a duo formed by Belgian producers Jean Vanesse and Thomas Sohet. He is also active under the name Only Freak.

item.title: Gloria Gaynor – Never Can Say Goodbye '97
item.description: A House/Disco track that was remixed by Italian label Nicolosi Productions of the famous song “Never Can Say Goodbye”, which was covered by Gloria Gaynor in 1974, and released by Italian house label Just Music.

item.title: Bangana – Refresh Bang Bang Bang
item.description: Bangana is a Swedish duo consisting of Alf Tumble and Magnus Rydén. Also active under the names S.U.M.O. and Tumble & Combo.

item.title: Umek – Oranazol
item.description: Umek is a legendary DJ in the Slovenian techno world who performs at over 100 venues a year around the world, from underground clubs in Berlin to EDC Las Vegas.

item.title: Tomaz vs Filterheadz – Latin Loopworks
item.description: Tomaz vs Filterheadz is a collaboration between Belgian techno DJ and producer Tomaz (aka Thomas Janssens) and the duo Filterheadz (Bert Filip Wilmaers & Maarten Jan Wilmaers).

item.title: Tepr – En Direct De La Côte
item.description: Tanguy Destable, also known as Tepr, is a French musician, composer, and artistic director.

item.description: Peter Presta is a DJ, producer, and remixer from Brooklyn. He has collaborated with and remixed various artists including Masters At Work, Danny Tenaglia, Moby, Joey Beltram, Robbie Rivera, Cevin Fisher, Ray Roc, StoneBridge, Peter Rauhofer and DJ Chus.

item.description: David Ortega, also known as Mendo, is a Swiss DJ, producer, and founder of the label Clarisse Records.

item.title: Meat vs. Einzelkind – Meat Is Murder E.P.
item.description: Carsten Schuchmann, also known as Meat, founded Freebase Recordshop in Frankfurt, Germany in the early 1990s, and has held Freebase-Tours and See Us There Festivals in Europe. As a producer, he is active on labels such as Get Physical, Klang, Kindisch, murmur, and La Peña. Since 2009, he has been working with Chris Wood as the DJ/producer duo Chris Wood & Meat.

item.title: Bros – Too Much
item.description: Bros was a British pop band that was active from 1987 to 1992. At the time of formation, twin brothers Matt & Luke Goss (Matt Goss & Luke Goss) , was a trio with Craig Logan, but in early 1989 Craig Logan left the band and they started working as a duo. The manager is former Pet Shop Boys manager Tom Watkins.

item.description: “Tender Lover” is the second studio album by American R&B singer-songwriter Babyface, released in 1989 by the label SOLAR (Sound of Los Angeles Records).

item.description: Alexander Seton Coke, also known as Alex Coke, is an American jazz saxophonist and flutist from Dallas.

item.description: Rozalla Miller, also known as Rozalla, is a Zimbabwean electronic music performer originally from what is now Zambia. A globally successful dance artist known as the “Queen of Rave”.

item.description: Re-edited by NY-based DJ bossy boots (Elinah). Unofficial release promo version.

item.description: Pearl Brothers is a Japanese rock unit formed in 1983 and debuted in 1986. The band members are set to be “brothers.”

item.description: Yann Larret-Menezo, also known as Le Tone, is an electronic music artist, journalist, and illustrator from France.

item.description: Europop released in 1989 by the Trax Music label.

item.title: Jerry Goldsmith – A Patch Of Blue
item.description: Soundtrack of the 1965 American film ““A Patch of Blue.’’ Reissue released in 1978.

item.description: Hakan Lidbo is a Swedish pop/dance music producer who remixes and collaborates with artists such as Fatboy Slim, Yello, Depeche Mode, and Kool Keith. He also manages Swedish dance labels MNW Dance, Left < > Right Recordings, and runs Container Recordings with John Andersson.

item.description: A. Jack -Welcome To The Lost Child Club〜Jack-

item.description: “Time” is Rebecca”s fifth album, released in 1986 on the FITZBEAT label. The catchphrases for this album are ““It”s not about logic…” and ““Boredom and cramps are all thrown into the trash can.”

item.description: Psycho Cowboys (aka Hedfu_k) is a project by UK-based producer/composer Aaron Gilbert and London-born electronic DJ/producer Stretch Silvester, aka Stuart Collins.

item.description: Perfect Phase is a project by Freek Fontein (The Freak) and Willem Faber (Mac Zimms), Dutch techno, trance, and hard house DJs and producers who have been active since the 1980s.

item.description: Neutron Tom is the alias of UK hard dance producer, remixer & DJ, Thomas Ingamells. He is better known as Ingo.

item.description: A project by happy hardcore artist Mickey Skeedale (Bazooka Joe), who runs the label Angel Atom Records, and UK happy hardcore and hard house producer Paul Clarke (Dougal).

item.description: The first and second songs on Side A are remixes by Italian HOUSE DJ/producer Andrea T. Mendoza and production duo T&F of Mauro Ferrucci & Frankie Tamburo.

item.description: DJ Gilb-R is the alias of French electronic music producer Gilbert Cohen.

item.description: Beroshima is a German techno/electro project formed in 1994 by Frank Muller. It was later joined by Ulrich Schnauss, but is now Frank Muller’s solo project.

item.description: Lasse Mosegard / Illinton, also known as Bebop Dawg, is a musician and producer based in Barcelona.

item.description: A house/deep house track released by the label Numoment Recordings in 2014.

item.description: The Peacocks are a rockabilly band formed in Switzerland in 1990. They have toured not only in Europe but also all over the world, including the United States, Canada, and Japan.

item.description: Swod is a recording project by musicians Oliver Doerell and Stephan Wöhrmann.

item.description: Rednose Distrikt began as a collaboration between Amsterdam-based band Kid Sublime and Steven de Peven, before Kid Sublime left and Mike Kivits, aka Aardvarck, joined. Their sound is characterized by a mix of various elements, including broken beat, offside techno, cut-up soul, and sampled slapstick jazz.

item.title: Raw Stylus – Use Me
item.description: Raw Stylus, a British acid jazz band active in the 1990s, covered Bill Withers’ 1972 soul/R&B masterpiece “Use Me.”

item.title: LSK – LSK
item.description: LSK (real name Leigh Stephen Kenny) is a singer-songwriter and producer from the UK.

item.description: A house/deep house compilation mix CD selected by US DJ/producer David Alvarado, who has produced works for labels such as Ovum, Peacefrog, NRK, Plastic City, and Ultra.

item.title: Crystal Waters – The Boy From Ipanema
item.description: Crystal Waters is an American house and dance music singer-songwriter known for her hit songs “Gypsy Woman” and “100% Pure Love” in the 1990s.

item.title: Akabu Featuring Linda Clifford – Ride The Storm Part One (Joey Negro Mixes)
item.description: Dave Lee, also known as Akabu, is a British DJ, producer, and remixer. Dave Lee was best known as Joey Negro since 1990, but took a break from performing as Joey Negro in July 2020 following the George Floyd protests.

item.title: Superfly – B With U
item.description: UK R&B singer Dee Jacobee”s “I”m Alive” by American DJ/house music artist A house track remixed by remixers Todd Terry and D.A.R.C.

item.description: A double A-side techno track released by the label Beatstreet in 2008.

item.title: P.M. Dawn – Of The Heart, Of The Soul And Of The Cross The Utopian Experience
item.description: PM Dawn is an American hip-hop and R&B group formed in New Jersey in 1988 by brothers Attrell Cordes and Jarrett Cordes. In the early 1990s, they achieved crossover success by fusing hip-hop, soul, and pop-oriented urban R&B.

item.title: Darren Tate & Jono Grant – Shine
item.description: Darren Tate is a house trance dance music DJ/producer from the UK who is a member of JODA and also works under the names DT8 Project and 8 Ball.

item.title: Bitasika – Pali Pali
item.description: Bitasika is an African band led by BB Mo-Franck, a performer from the Democratic Republic of the Congo and the first percussionist of the Shiki Theater Company ““The Lion King’’. Drummer/percussionist Jun Watanabe JunJun also participates.

item.title: DJ Rush – Let"s Change
item.description: Isaiah Major, also known as DJ Rush, is a techno and house DJ and producer from Chicago and based in Germany. He also works under the names Major Rush and Russian Roulette.

item.title: Dee Jacobee – I"m Alive Todd Terry Mix
item.description: UK R&B singer Dee Jacobee”s “I”m Alive” by American DJ/house music artist A house track remixed by remixers Todd Terry and D.A.R.C.

item.title: Sanjiva – Secret Rooms Over Flowing Delight
item.description: A techno ambient trance track by Charles Reix, also known as Sanjiva. It was released in 1996 on Sanjiva’s own label Ninetysix Sounds. He also worked under the name Charles Kyosan.

item.title: Prince Rahiem – Rock Wit' It
item.description: Rahiem Thomas, also known as Prince Rahiem, is an American rapper from Miami who debuted in 1988 as a member of The Get Funky Crew. Collaborated with Beatmaster Clay D on the 1990 album “Pullit All the Way Down.” As a solo artist, he released two albums: Loose My Money (1992) and On a Ride (1994).

item.title: Philippe B – Can You Feel It
item.description: “Janeiro”, a vocal trance track by Dutch producer group Solid Sessions featuring Pronti & Kalmani, has been remixed by numerous famous DJs since its release in 2000.

item.title: Liberty – Seguro
item.description: Liberty is a duo consisting of Belgian DJ/producers Johan Goyvaerts (DJ Liberty) and Maurits Engelen (Maurizzio). Maurizzio’s uncle is Praga Khan, who is considered one of the pioneers of the Belgian new beat/acid house/techno-electronic dance music scene.

item.title: Kelly-G Perfect Rhythm – Trip Into The Future
item.description: The producer is Aron Friedman, also known as Kelly-G, who is from the UK and based in the US.

item.title: Gamma Loop – X-Ray Eyes
item.description: Gamma Loop is the name used by German producer and sound designer Jürgen Driessen for his German hard trance/acid project. He is also active under various other names such as Bruce Wayne and Exit EEE.

item.title: Futureshock – Pride"s Paranoia
item.description: Futureshock are UK DJ/producers Alex Tepper and Phil Dockerty. electronic duo by. Mainly active from 1998 to 2003.

item.description: A garage house track remixed by UK R&B singer Dee Jacobee”s “I”m Alive” by Jazz-N-Groove, a US house production team active in the 90’s NY house scene.

item.title: Chris McCormack – There Are Better Ways
item.description: Chris McCormack is a UK techno producer. “There Are Better Ways” is a two-disc house set. record.

item.title: Aphrohead aka Felix Da Housecat – In The Dark We Live (Remixes)
item.description: Aphrohead is the alias of second-generation Chicago house legend Felix Da Housecat.

item.title: Solid Sessions Feat. Pronti & Kalmani – Janeiro (Remixes)
item.description: “Janeiro”, a vocal trance track by Dutch producer group Solid Sessions featuring Pronti & Kalmani, has been remixed by numerous famous DJs since its release in 2000.

item.title: Mr. Gelbeck – Trois
item.description: Mr. Gelbeck, who unofficially releases high-quality house mixes, is rumored to be the pseudonym of a famous French artist.

item.title: DJ Tandu Presents Ayla – Singularity Brainchild II
item.description: DJ Tandu and Ayla are the names of German DJ and producer Ingo Kunzi’s trance projects.

item.title: DJ Arne L II Presents Divino – Proper To Men
item.description: Arne Leistikow, also known as DJ Arne L II, is a DJ and producer from Germany. “Proper To Men” is a hard house/hard trance track released by the German label Deep Mission Trance in 2000.

item.title: Acues & Elitist – Zonderland
item.description: Acues & Elitist is a duo consisting of Fernando Moreno Menargues and Sergio Sala Garcia. “Zonderland” is a trance track released in 2005 by the Dutch label profuse.

item.title: Stevie Wonder – Part-Time Lover
item.description: “Part-Time Lover” was released as the first single from R&B singer-songwriter Stevie Wonder’s 20th studio album, In Square Circle (1985).

item.title: Sash! – La Primavera
item.description: Sash! (Sash!) is a German DJ and production team consisting of Ralf Kappmeier, Karl Xander, Thomas “Alisson” Lüdke, and Sascha Lappessen.

item.description: Kenneth Lundgaard Bager, also known as Dr. Baker, is a producer and DJ from Denmark. He is regarded as one of the pioneers of Danish techno and house music, hosting the legendary “Coma” parties in the late 1980s.

item.description: C.F.Q Project is the alias of British keyboard player, percussionist and producer Dave Rawlings.

item.description: A two-disc compilation album featuring Japanese and American hip-hop artists, released in 2000 by the Japanese hip-hop label Future Shock.

item.title: Mr. Gelbeck – Hurry Hurry Hurry & Love Apple
item.description: Mr. Gelbeck, who unofficially releases high-quality house mixes, is rumored to be the pseudonym of a famous French artist.

item.title: Mr. Gelbeck – Deuxieme
item.description: Mr. Gelbeck, who unofficially releases high-quality house mixes, is rumored to be the pseudonym of a famous French artist.

item.description: “Gigolo Supreme – After The Storm” is a classic house music 12-inch single released by Nervous Records in 1996 and produced by Frankie Feliciano.

item.title: PYT – Same Ol' Same Ol'
item.description: P.Y.T. is a US girl group from Florida that was active from 1998 to 2002.

item.title: Rah Digga – Dirty Harriet
item.description: Dirty Harriet (2000) is the debut studio album by Rahim Fisher, aka Rah Digga, and is an underrated but important piece in hip-hop history.

item.title: Pearl Jam – Yield
item.description: Pearl Jam is an American rock band formed in Seattle in 1990. They are known as a major band of the grunge movement in the early 1990s, along with Soundgarden and Nirvana, and are said to be “the most popular American rock and roll band of the 90s.”

item.title: Madonna – True Blue
item.description: True Blue, released in 1986, is Madonna’s third studio album. The dance-pop album, influenced by Motown sounds, girl groups, and Latin pop, became a worldwide hit.

item.title: Kraftwerk – The Mix
item.description: Kraftwerk was founded in 1970 by Ralf Hütter and Florian Schneider. German electro-techno band. He is a representative of krautrock and is also known as a pioneer of techno-hop.

item.title: Groove Twins – Action
item.description: Groove Twins is an A.Beat-C project by intern changing vocalists like Go Go Girls and King & Queen.

item.title: Buggles – The Age Of Plastic
item.description: The Buggles are a British new wave band formed in 1977 by Trevor Horn and Geoff Downes. Their 1979 debut single, ““Video Killed the Radio Star,’’ became a worldwide hit.

item.title: VA – Trojan Calypso Box Set
item.description: Trojan Calypso Compilation

item.title: VA – Hello Young Lovers
item.description: A compilation album released in 1993 by Kenji Takimi’s indie label Crue-L Records.

item.title: Ned's Atomic Dustbin – Kill Your Television
item.description: Ned’s Atomic Dustbin are a British rock band formed in Stourbridge, West Midlands in November 1987.

item.title: Eggstone - In San Diego
item.description: Eggstone is a Swedish indie pop band formed in 1986. He is said to be the godfather of Swedish pop.

item.title: VA – Maharaja Top 20 Vol. III
item.description: Maharaja TOP20 vol.Ⅲ

item.title: Special Others – Star
item.description: Special Others is a Japanese jam band whose style is a mix of improvisational jazz and post-rock. Each member has a middle name given to them by Afrobeat founder and legendary drummer Tony Allen.

item.title: Modest Mouse – We Were Dead Before
item.description: Modest Mouse is a US alternative rock and indie rock band formed in Washington State in 1992 and currently based in Portland, Oregon.

item.title: Marco Sfogli – reMarcoble
item.description: Marco Sfogli is an Italian guitarist. He has performed with James LaBrie of the US progressive metal band Dream Theater, PFM, Icefish, and others.

item.title: T99 – Nocturne
item.description: T99 is a Belgian hardcore techno unit that led the club scene in the 90s. Released in 1991, “Anasthasia” and “Nocturne” were both huge hits and became anthems for the club and rave scene of the early ’90s.

item.title: El Cubano – Esta E' La Vida
item.description: A Latin house/Brazilian house/tribal house/dub mix record of El Cubano’s hit single “Esta E’ La Vida” released in 1997.

item.title: El Cantor – Toma '96 Remixes!
item.description: Davidson Ospina, also known as El Cantor, is a house DJ from New York. He runs his own label, Ospina Digital records. He is also a remixer who has created remixes for many famous artists, including Christina Aguilera”s ““Ain”t No Other Man” and Beyonce’s ““Broken Hearted Girl.”

item.title: The Prodigy – Invaders Must Die
item.description: This album is the fifth studio album by UK electronic dance music group The Prodigy. The album, released in 2009, was the first to include all band members in the production process and was a commercial success.

item.title: Soeur Plus! – Agio
item.description: The debut album by Dutch duo Soeur Plus!, released in 1996.

item.title: Prodigy – The Fat Of The Land
item.description: Prodigy is a British electronic punk rock band formed in 1990 by producer Liam Howlett.

item.title: Joe Hisaishi - BRAIN&MIND Soundtrack Vol.1
item.description: Soundtrack for the NHK special ““Amazing Microcosm: Human Body 2: Brain and Mind’’, composed by Joe Hisaishi, a composer known for the Hayao Miyazaki anime. Although it was released in 1993, this album, which expresses the microcosm through sound, is an album that will be listened to through the ages.

item.title: Ben Sims – Theory Of Interpretation A Mastermix By Ben Sims
item.description: Ben Sims is a heavyweight in the techno world who has been active at the forefront of the UK rave scene in the 80”s and the UK dance scene in the 90”s for many years.

item.title: VA – This Is Latinamyl
item.description: A compilation album released in 1997 by breakbeat label Fused & Bruised, founded by multi-genre electronic music producer and DJ Simon Shackleton, aka Elite Force, who also worked on music for the movie The Matrix.

item.title: The Sabers Of Paradise – Haunted Dancehall
item.description: The Sabers Of Paradise are a UK electronic music group from London. Members: Andrew Weatherall, Jagz Kooner, Gary Burns.

item.title: Regurgitator – ...Art
item.description: Regurgitator is an alternative rock band from Australia. Formed in late 1993 by Quan Yeomans on lead vocals, guitar, and keyboards, Ben Ely on bass guitar, keyboards, and vocals, and Martin Lee on drums.

item.title: Oliver Ho – Sentience
item.description: Oliver Ho is a techno DJ and producer based in London.

item.title: Moe. – Dither
item.description: Moe is an American jam rock band formed at the University at Buffalo in 1989.

item.title: K Hand – Salsafied
item.description: K: Hand, also known as Kelli Hand, is a techno house musician and DJ from Detroit. In the 1990s, she was known as one of the leading black women in the male-dominated techno and electronic music scene, and was called the ““First Lady of Detroit Techno.’’ He continued to create music until his passing in 2021.

item.title: G. Love & Special Sauce – G. Love & Special Sauce
item.description: G. Love & Special Sauce is a rock band from Philadelphia. Characterized by an organic and unique style that mixes elements of blues, hip-hop, rock, and soul.

item.title: Eric B. & Rakim – Paid In Full
item.description: Eric B. & Rakim are an American hip-hop duo formed in Long Island, New York in 1986 by DJ Eric B. and rapper Rakim.

item.title: Corduroy – High Havoc
item.description: Corduroy is a four-piece acid jazz band based in London.

item.title: Biosphere – Cirque
item.description: Geir Jenssen, also known as Biosphere, is an electronic ambient musician from Norway. Living in Tromsø, within the Arctic Circle, we are characterized by an ambient and ambient house style inspired by the nature and mountains of the Arctic Circle.

item.title: Baths – Cerulean
item.description: Will Wiesenfeld, also known as Baths, is known as a genius beat maker and is an electronic musician based in LA.

item.title: A'me Lorain & The Family Affair – Starring In...Standing In A Monkey Sea
item.description: This album, released by RCA in 1990, is the debut album by American pop singer A’me Lorain, front of the funk band The Family Affair. The Japanese title is “Tokimeki no Wonderland”

item.title: Total Eclipse – Update Files
item.description: Total Eclipse is a project started in 1992 by three French producers. He became famous for his goa-trance albums released in 1995 and 1996.

item.title: Nightmares On Wax – Smokers Delight
item.description: Nightmares On Wax”s Smokers Delight (1995), the second album from British producer George Evelyn”s project, was released on Warp Records and cemented its place in downtempo and trip-hop history. This album remains a timeless masterpiece, transporting listeners to a soothing chill-out realm, a step removed from the hustle and bustle of club culture.

item.title: Model 500 – Deep Space
item.description: Model 500 was the alias used by DJ and producer Juan Atkins, known as one of the pioneers of Detroit techno, until 2008. Since 2008, Model 500 has featured Juan Atkins, Underground Resistance’s Milton Baldwin (DJ Skurge) & Mark Taylor.

item.title: Mike & Rich – Expert Knob Twiddlers
item.description: Mike & Rich’s “Expert Knob Twiddlers” (1996) is a collaborative album by Richard D. James, aka Aphex Twin, and Mike Paradinas, aka µ-Ziq, two geniuses who led the electronic music scene in the 90s.

item.title: Kenny Larkin – The Narcissist
item.description: Kenny Larkin is a techno house producer and DJ from Detroit. He began his career under the influence of Juan Atkins and Derrick May, and has released on numerous labels including Richie Hawtin and John Acquaviva’s labels Plus 8, Buzz, and Warp.

item.title: Joel Mull – Imagination
item.description: Joel Mull’s debut album Imagination (2000) remains special to many listeners as the Swedish techno artist left a lasting impression on the scene.

item.title: Tony O"Connor – Hidden Forest
item.description: Tony O’Connor is an ambient/relaxation music creator based in Queensland, Australia.

item.title: Outside – Sus?icious
item.description: Outside is a UK jazz-funk group formed by Matt Cooper, Andreas Allen, and Patrice Blanchard.

item.title: Aux 88 – Electro Boogie
item.description: Studio K7’s third electro boogie released in 1999. Detroit techno/electro mixCD by Aux88.

item.title: Autechre – Peel Session 2
item.description: Peel Session 2 is Autechre’s second John Peel session, broadcast on September 8, 1999, and the CD was released on Warp Records in 2000.

item.title: VA – Mellow Beats, Spirits & Wisdom
item.description: Released in 2008 by P-Vine Records A jazzy & mellow HIPHOP compilation album selected and supervised by Toru Hashimoto.

item.title: Deep Forest – Deep Forest
item.description: Deep Forest is a duo formed in 1992 by Michel Sanchez and Éric Mouquet. It is characterized by a world music style called ethnic electronica, which is a mix of ethnic, electronic, dance beats, and chillout beats.

item.title: Helen Merrill – Helen Merrill
item.description: Helen Merrill was an American jazz vocalist who was active in the 1950s and 1960s.

item.title: Engenheiros Do Hawaii – Surfando Karmas & DNA
item.description: Engenheiros do Hawaii (Engineers from Hawaii) was a Brazilian rock band formed in Porto Alegre in 1983 and active until 2008. It gained great popularity for its wordplay and sarcastic, critical songs. Vocalist and bassist Humberto Gessinger is the only original member.

item.title: Common Factor – Dreams Of Elsewhere
item.description: Nick Calingaert, also known as Common Factor, is a DJ from Chicago. In the mid-90s, he was active as a drum and bass DJ under the name Saint Nick.

item.title: Tony de Vit – Are You All Ready UFO
item.description: Anthony de Vit, also known as Tony de Vit, is a UK DJ and producer. He is credited with bringing the hard house and hard NRG sounds that were prevalent in Birmingham and London’s underground scenes to mainstream clubs, and is considered one of the most influential figures of the era.

item.title: Raoul Zerna – Inside The Grooves
item.description: Raoul Zerna is a DJ and producer whose house beat style is influenced by techno, tech house, and Latin. He has roots in Ecuador and is based in Los Angeles. As a DJ, he has collaborated with artists such as Carl Cox, DJ Sneak, Bad Boy Bill, DJ Dan, and DJ Keoki, and has played at festivals and live shows around the world.

item.title: Lynch – I Found Out
item.description: Roger Lynch (real name Roger Troutman II), also known as Lynch, is the son of legendary US funk musician Roger Troutman.

item.title: Gaetek – Pain023
item.description: Gaetek, also known as Gaetano Parisio, is a DJ and producer from Italy. Known as one of the founders of the Neapolitan techno scene, he has released on various famous labels such as Drumcode, Planet Rhythm Records, Primate Recordings, Zenit, Kombination Research and Mosaic.

item.title: Randy Travis – Storms Of Life
item.description: Randy Travis is an American country singer and actor who has been active since 1979.

item.title: Planet '95 – Talk To Me
item.description: Planet 95 is a unit composed of Antonio D’Ambrosio, Claudio Ferrante, Pasquale De Crescenzo, and Renato De Crescenzo.

item.title: VA – Spike & Co. Do It A Cappella
item.description: This album is the soundtrack for a 1990 PBS documentary about a cappella music directed by Spike Lee.

item.title: The Cranberries – Wake Up And Smell the Coffee
item.description: The Cranberries are an Irish alternative rock band formed in 1989. Their style is characterized by incorporating elements of indie rock, jungle pop, dream pop, folk rock, post-punk, and pop rock.

item.title: Sliced ​​Pack – Live In Glasgow 2003
item.description: Sliced ​​Pack is a duo formed by Italian DJ/producers Danilo Rispoli and Vincenzo Callea. He also works under other names as Callea & Rispoli, Junk Yard Dog, and Le Soleil.

item.title: Polo Project – Oceano Tribale
item.description: Polo Project is the alias of Italian DJ and producer Marco Cecere. He also works under the names Cecè, Marco Polo, and Zen.

item.title: Petter – Untitled Acid EP
item.description: Petter Nordkvist is a DJ and producer from Stockholm, Sweden. Their unique style is a mix of techno, electro, dub, ambient, acid, break, and deep house. He plays not only in Sweden, but also at Border Community events in London and throughout Europe.

item.title: Violent Femmes – The Blind Leading The Naked
item.description: Violent Femmes is an American folk-punk band from Milwaukee, Wisconsin. Considered an integral part of the underground folk-punk and alternative rock scenes of the 1980s, they had a major influence on subsequent movements, particularly in folk rock, indie rock, grunge, pop-punk, emo, and alternative rock scenes of the late 1980s and 1990s.

item.title: Robotman – Do Da Doo (Remixes)
item.description: “Robotman – Do Da Doo (Remixes)” is a remix album of Richie Hawtin’s project “Robotman” released in 1994. This album contains several different remixes.

item.title: R_Görl – Final Metal Pralinées
item.description: Robert Görl, also known as R_Görl, is a musician from Munich, Germany. He is also famous for forming NDW (Neue Deutsche Welle), EBM (Electronic Body Music), NDH (Neue Deutsche Heate), and Deutsch Amerikanische Freundschaft (DAF), known as the pioneers of techno, with Gabi Delgado.

item.title: Ballistic Brothers – Peckings Come On
item.description: Ballistic Brothers was a downbeat band based in England in the 90s, formed by X-Press 2’s Ashley Beedle, Rocky & Diesel, and David Hill (Nuphonic Records). Characterized by a funky electronica style influenced by jazz.

item.title: As One – Celestial Soul
item.description: AS ONE is the name of the solo project of British DJ and techno producer Kirk Degiorgio. Their style is a mix of Detroit techno, funk, soul, and jazz.

item.title: Freddie McGregor – Carry Go Bring Come
item.description: Freddie McGregor is a reggae musician from Jamaica. He was just seven years old when he began recording for the Studio One label in 1963. In 1975, he converted to Rastafarianism.

item.title: VA – Tank Girl
item.description: Soundtrack of the post-apocalyptic sci-fi movie ““Tank Girl”’ directed by Rachel Talalay, which was released in theaters in 1995. Tank Girl is a live-action adaptation of a comic that has a cult following in the UK. The soundtrack was assembled by Courtney Love, and SPK”s Graeme Revell provided original music. Devo recorded a new version of “Girl U Want” for the movie because she was a big fan of the comic.

item.title: Tracy Chapman – Tracy Chapman
item.description: Tracy Chapman is an American singer-songwriter widely known for her hit singles “Fast Car” (1988) and “Give Me One Reason” (1995).

item.title: The Rapture – In The Grace Of Your Love
item.description: The Rapture is a US dance punk rock band from New York formed in 1998. They disbanded in 2014, but resumed their activities in 2019.

item.title: Junior Vasquez – Twilo Volume 1
item.description: A 2-disc set of House mixes by DJ Junior Vasquez released by Virgin in 2000.

item.title: VA – Long Live Tibet
item.description: Charity CD released in 1997. Proceeds from the sale of this CD were donated to the Tibet House Trust charity which supports the liberation of Tibet and Tibetan refugees.

item.title: Thom Yorke – The Eraser
item.description: “The Eraser” is the debut solo album by UK musician Thom Yorke, released in 2006 by XL Recordings. The producer is Nigel Godrich, the longtime producer of Thom Yorke’s band Radiohead.

item.title: Les Rallizes Dénudés – Live 1972
item.description: Les Rallizes Dénudés/Hadaka no rariizu is an experimental noise rock/psychedelic rock band formed in Kyoto in 1967, led by Takashi Mizutani. Naked Larrys, who were active from the 1960s to the 1990s, had a huge influence on the noise rock scene both in Japan and abroad, and still boasts cult popularity. The original members were Takashi Mizutani, Takeshi Nakamura, and Morisuke Wakabayashi. In addition, the members are in flux, with Fujio Yamaguchi (formerly known as Hachibu, later of Teardrops) and Makoto Kubota joining the group for a time. The group ceased its activities in 1996.

item.title: Justice – †
item.description: The debut album by Justice, a French electronic dance band that has been active since 2003. The album was released in 2007 by French label Ed Banger Records and was a worldwide success, including a Grammy nomination for Best Electronic/Dance Album.

item.title: David Bowie – 1. Outside
item.description: David Bowie’s 18th album was released in 1995 with producer Brian Eno. The 20th song is a bonus track exclusive to the first edition + Japan edition.

item.title: Beck – Mutations
item.description: “Mutations” is Beck’s sixth studio album, released in 1998 by DGC Records. It was produced by Nigel Godrich, known as the producer of Radiohead, and won the Grammy Award for Best Alternative Music Album.

item.title: VA – That's Eurobeat Vol. 22
item.description: The 22nd installment of the Italo-Disco/Hi-NRG/Eurobeat compilation series, released in 1990 on the Alfa label. Illustration by Shigenari Onishi.

item.title: Spiral Life – Flourish
item.description: “Flourish”, released in 1995, is Spiral Life’s third studio album and last album.

item.title: Rebecca – Remix Rebecca
item.description: Rebecca”s “Remix Rebecca” original cassette tape released by Fitzbeat in 1987. This is Rebecca”s first remix album and her best album. It was a big hit, reaching number 11 on the Oricon charts in 1987.

item.title: XTC – Nonesuch
item.description: “Nonsuch” is the 12th style album by UK rock band XTC, released by Virgin in 1992. The producer is Gus Dudgeon, who has worked on Elton John”s works. It was XTC”s most political album, touching on topics ranging from love and humanity to the Gulf War and P•T•Barnum, and was a hit in the US and UK.

item.title: The Chemical Brothers – Singles 93-03
item.description: “Singles 93–03” is a best-of singles collection album that commemorates the 10th anniversary of the formation of the UK electronic music duo The Chemical Brothers, which was released in 2003.It is a collection of singles released from 1993 to 2003. Comes with a special sticker that is included only for the first production.

item.title: Swing Out Sister – Shapes And Patterns
item.description: “Shapes And Patterns” is Swing Out Sister’s fifth studio album, released in 1997.

item.title: Riot – Inishmore
item.description: “Inishmore” is the 10th studio album by the American hard rock/heavy metal band Riot, which was released in Japan in 1997. This album is based on the sagas of Celtic and Irish mythology. The 12th track is a bonus track only available on the Japanese version. The members at the time of release were Mike DiMeo, Mark Reale, Mike Flyntz, Pete Perez, and Bobby Jarzombek.

item.title: Mighty Dub Katz & Cagedbaby – Southern Fried & Tested
item.description: A 2-CD set of house mixes by Mighty Dub Katz and Cagedbaby, a unit of Fatboy Slim, aka Norman Cook, and Gareth Hansome, released in 2007.

item.title: Kiss – Rock And Roll Over
item.description: A cassette tape of Kiss”s fifth studio album, ““Hell”s Rock Fire,’’ released by Casablanca in 1976. Domestic version (Japanese version).

item.title: Deep Forest – Boheme
item.description: “Boheme” is the second album by French duo Deep Forest, released in 1995. This album, which samples bohemian (Eastern European gypsy songs), is Deep Forest’s masterpiece, selling over 4 million copies, winning Diamond, Platinum, and Gold awards in 15 countries, and winning the Grammy Award for Best World Music Album.

item.title: Björk – Volta
item.description: Volta is Björk’s sixth studio album, released in 2007. Several artists are participating, including Mark Bell, Timbaland, Danja, and Antony Hegarty (Anohni Hegarty) of Antony & the Johnsons.

item.title: Beastie Boys – To The 5 Boroughs
item.description: “To the 5 Boroughs” is the sixth studio album by US hip-hop group Beastie Boys, released in 2004. The album debuted at number one on the Billboard 200, selling 360,000 copies in its first week and was certified platinum by the RIAA. The 12th track is a bonus track only available in the Japanese version.

item.title: Robert Johnson – The Legendary Blues Singer
item.description: Robert Johnson is a master of the blues and delta blues style, known as one of the most influential musicians of the 20th century.

item.title: Lutricia McNeal – My Side Of Town
item.description: US R&B singer Lutricia McNeal’s debut studio album. This contemporary R&B and Europop-inspired album was released in 1998 as a limited edition by Italian dance label Do It Yourself.

item.title: Euphone – The Lakewood
item.description: Euphone is a post-rock band based in Chicago.

item.title: Zongamin – Zongamin
item.description: Mukai Susumu Mukai, also known as Zongamin, is a Japanese musician and producer based in the UK. He is active as a remixer for Air, Playgroup, Graffiti, John Cale, Mickey Moonlight, Headman, Sandro Perri, Alexis Taylor, Seelenluft, etc., and plays as a member of Vanishing Twin, Becker & Mukai, Off World, Stalactite, School Of Hypnosis.

item.title: Radiohead – Airbag / How Am I Driving?
item.description: The fifth EP by UK rock band Radiohead, released in North America in 1998. Contains the B-sides of the singles (excluding “Lull” and “How I Made My Millions”) released from “OK Computer,” Radiohead’s third studio album and worldwide breakthrough, and “Airbag.”

item.title: Radiohead - Kid A
item.description: The fourth studio album by British rock band Radiohead, released in 2000. The producer is Nigel Godrich.

item.title: Original Love – Singles Back To 1991-1995
item.description: Original Love’s best album released in 1996. All singles released from 1991 to 1995 are included in the order of release.

item.title: Kazufumi Kodama A.K.A. 'Echo' From Dub Station – Requiem Dub
item.description: Kazufumi Kodama is a trumpet player who is active in dub bands such as MUTE BEAT and KODAMA AND THE DUB STATION BAND. He has also produced many artists such as Fishmans’ first album and CHIEKO BEAUTY.

item.title: Warlords Of Pez – Warlords Of Pez
item.description: Warlords Of Pez is an Irish rock band that seems to have come from a galaxy far, far away. Members include Chris Judge, a former member of the Irish indie pop band The Chalets.

item.title: Skrillex – Scary Monsters And Nice Sprites
item.description: Japanese version released in 2012. Tracks 1 to 6 are Skrillex original songs. The seventh song is a remix by Dutch drum and bass trio Noisia. The 8th song is a remix by DJ and producer Zedd, famous for ““Clarity” and Ariana Grande’s hit song ““Break Free.”

item.title: Resonance Meditation - Gong Geladag
item.description: The first album in the Lost & Found series supervised by Haruomi Hosono. Locally recorded sound source on April 17, 2000 in Bali using a 24bit 192KHz sonic system.

item.title: Proxy – Decoy
item.description: Evgeny Pozharnov, also known as Proxy, is a Russian electronic producer and DJ. They have had success playing at international festivals such as Coachella, EDC Las Vegas, I love Techno, Creamfields, Hard Summer, and Electric Zoo.

item.title: Pianoheadz – It"s Over (Distortion)
item.description: Pianoheadz is a unit formed by US house producers Jose Nuñez and Erick Morillo.

item.title: Martin Matiske – Blackout EP
item.description: Martin Matiske is a German DJ, producer, and composer. He also works under the name Blackploid.

item.title: DJ Chus And David Penn Feat. Caterina – Baila
item.description: A remix of DJ Chus & David Penn’s famous song “Baila” by US house DJ and producer Dennis Ferrer, famous for “Hey Hey”.

item.title: Tom Hades – Conception
item.description: Wim Vanoeveren, also known as Tom Hades, is a techno/techhouse DJ and producer based in Belgium. A stalwart of the Belgian techno scene, he runs the label Rhythm Convert (currently under the name Rhythm Converted).

item.title: Sergio Del Rio – Parazaar
item.description: Sergio Del Rio is a DJ and producer from Italy. He also works under the names DJ Power, Ethnosonique, Gambafreaks, etc.

item.title: San Laurentino – Love Potion E.P.
item.description: A deep house/ambient house track released in 2010 in a limited edition of 250 copies by Electric Minds, a label in London’s East End that releases remixes by ARTHUR RUSSELL. Limited edition.

item.title: Rectal Rangers – Hamoroids / Overload
item.description: Rectal Rangers is a project by Gorden Flintrop, Kevin Sieja, and Oliver Cats. There is another name called Stormcatchers.

item.title: Electribe 101 – You're Walking
item.description: Electribe 101 was a group that was active from 1988 to 1992. The front is Billie Ray Martin.

item.title: East 17 – Gold
item.description: East 17 was formed in 1991 by Tony Mortimer, Brian Harvey, John Hendy, and Terry Caldwell, and was the most popular boy band in the UK in the early to mid-1990s.

item.title: Dave Hammond – Africa
item.description: Dave Hammond is a Eurobeat project from the prestigious Italo disco label Time Records.

item.title: Dangerzone Pres. Patrick Marsh – Killing Fire
item.description: A trance track released in 2002 by Reality Bites Records, a German label specializing in trance, hard trance, and progressive trance.

item.title: Corrina Joseph – Wish Tonite / Lonely
item.description: Corrina Joseph is a singer who rose to fame through her collaboration with Basement Jaxx. He has also collaborated with artists such as Underground Solution, Kamasutra, Masterbuilders, Nightmares on Wax, Classen Collective, Russ Gabriel, and Harlem Zip Code.

item.title: Tonga – Welcome To Sambatown
item.description: TONGA, a project by DJ Corradino, Gianluca Lul, and Mauro Gazzotti, is a Latin house remake of the classic samba classic Welcome To Sambatown. A masterpiece played by many DJs such as EMMA.

item.title: Todh Teri – Live at Indernet 2020 / Cologne
item.description: A DJ sound source performed by Todh Teri, a rising star of the Balearics and a mysterious producer who continues to release masterpieces such as the Bollywood disco edit, Deep in India, at the event “INDERNET 2020” hosted by Masala Movement.

item.title: Robert Drewek – Acidition
item.description: Robert Drewek is the general manager of DBH Music, an electronic music distributor based in Frankfurt, Germany. He is also active as a duo RDRS with Robin Scholz.

item.title: Mr. Vegas – Reggae Euphoria
item.description: The album “Reggae Euphoria” was released in 2014 from Mr.Vegas’ own label MV Music. It also includes reggae and dancehall classics, as well as remakes of famous songs from yesteryear.

item.title: Tweet – Oops (Oh My)
item.description: Charlene Keys, also known as Tweet, is an American R&B/soul singer, songwriter, guitarist, and actress.

item.title: Tim Hutton – Been A Fool
item.description: Tim Hutton is a UK producer, songwriter, and multi-instrumentalist. He is also active in the experimental techno duo Vulva and Yoni with Thomas Melchior.

item.title: Staxx Of Joy Featuring Carol Leeming – You
item.description: Staxx Of Joy is a unit formed by house/garage producers Simon Thorne and Tom Jones.

item.title: Space Cowboy – Running Away
item.description: Nicolas Jean-Pierre Patrick Dresti, also known as Space Cowboy, is a French-British DJ, singer-songwriter, and producer. He has released under various names such as DJ Apex, DJ Supreme, and Kings Of Rhythm, but has been using Space Cowboy since 2002. Since the late 2000s, he has been Lady Gaga’s personal DJ.

item.title: Sha'dasious – U Kant Play Me
item.description: Sha’dasious – U Kant Play Me / Phunk Wucha Heard Shadacious

item.title: Rednex – Cotton Eye Joe
item.description: Rednex – Cotton Eye Joe

item.title: Terrell – Unstoppable
item.description: A hip-hop track released by rapper Terrell in 2000 on the label I.Q. Records.

item.title: Stereo De Luxe – Soul Sauce
item.description: Stereo de Luxe is a DJ/producer duo from Berlin.

item.title: Stereo Action Unlimited – Lovelight
item.description: Stereo Action Unlimited is the duo of Christoph H. Müller and Philippe Cohen.

item.title: Snap! – Ooops Up
item.description: Snap! is a German Eurodance group.

item.title: Toledo – Joe
item.description: House acid jazz track by Toledo (Toledo Diamond). The producer is Danny Saber, a former member of Black Grape.

item.title: Tecmania Rebel – The Violet E.P.
item.description: Tecmania Rebel is DJ Patrick, also known as Patrick Van Der Hart. He was once a resident at Hollywood Music Hall, a famous club in Rotterdam, the Netherlands.

item.title: Robbie Craig – Special
item.description: Robbie Craig is a singer-songwriter from London. He has been active as the lead vocalist of East17 since 2014 after Brian Harvey left the band.

item.title: Mr. Blank – On The Ground
item.description: Another name for Steve Miller, an electronic downtempo chillout producer from the UK.

item.title: DJ Flex And Sandy W – Love For You
item.description: David Terzian, also known as DJ Flex, is a house/tech house DJ and producer from Paris. Sandy Wilhelm, also known as Sandy W, is an electro/house DJ and producer based in Paris.

item.title: Krafty Kuts – Uptight / Where"s The Noise
item.description: Martin Reeves, also known as Krafty Kuts, is a breakout DJ and producer from Brighton. In 2006, he won Best DJ at the Breakspoll Awards, which is said to be the highest award in the breaks world.

item.title: Remo Feat. D'Mia – Freakless
item.description: “Freakless” is a techno and electro record released in 2006 by the German label Dance Electric.

item.title: Marco V – Godd
item.description: Marinus Verkuijlen, also known as Marco V, is a Dutch electronic music DJ. He is a pioneer of Tech-Trance and is considered one of the most important trance artists. He is also active under other names such as VISION20/20.

item.title: Kreidler – Circles
item.description: Kreidler is a band formed in Düsseldorf, Germany in 1994. Fusing electronic and acoustic instruments, they incorporate various styles such as techno, electropop, avant-garde, post-rock, ambient, electronica, and krautrock depending on the release.

item.title: Dub Tractor – Scary H H Loop / 104 Dub
item.description: Anders Remmer, also known as Dub Tractor, is a leading figure in the electronic community in Copenhagen, Denmark, and is an electronic musician, producer, and film music composer. He also works under the names “Future 3” and “System” with Thomas Knak (aka Opiate) and Jesper Skaaning (aka Acustic).

item.title: Drumagick – Cambraia / Brasil
item.description: Brazilian electronic music veterans Drumagick are a São Paulo-based DJ/producer duo formed by brothers JrDeep and Guilherme Lopes.

item.title: David Donohoe – Nature Morte!
item.description: David Donohoe is a creative director, graphic designer, electronic musician and experimental musician based in Dublin, Ireland.

item.title: Max Lee – Intak Sistem
item.description: Max Lee, also known as Massimo Favarin, is an Italian producer and DJ. He was also active as a member of Italian techno projects Klima and Adrenalina.

item.title: Delon & Dalcan – Fascination / In The Sound
item.description: Delon & Dalcan is a project by French artist and musician Andre Dalcan and Greg Delon, a DJ at the famous club Barlive in Montpellier and other famous clubs in France and Spain. As Delon & Dalcan, he has also produced for famous labels such as Confused, Great Stuff Recordings, Boxer, and Propperproud.

item.title: Daedelus – Make It So
item.description: LA-based US music producer Alfred Weisberg-Roberts, known as Daedelus, is an artist who constructs a unique sound through experimental methods that mix various musical elements. “Make It So” is a single cut from the studio album “Love to Make Music To” released by the prestigious UK label Ninja Tune in 2008.

item.title: Da Techno Bohemian – Bangin' Bass
item.description: Da Techno Bohemian is a studio project between Rotterdam-born DJ and electronic music producer Koen Groeneveld and (hard) house DJ and producer Addy van der Zwan. The duo also perform under a number of other names, including The Ultimate Seduction and Klubbheads.

item.title: Kujay Dada – Let It Play
item.description: Kujay Dada is a project by UK trance DJs and producers Danny Graham, Dave Cowen, Jon Constantine, and Kurt Howes.

item.title: Klaxons – Golden Skans
item.description: A remix of ““Golden Skans’’ by the rock band Klaxons, formed in New Cross, UK in 2005.

item.title: Kele Le Roc – Let Me Know
item.description: Kelly Biggs, also known as Kele Le Roc, is a British R&B/UK Garage/Britpop singer.

item.title: K-Ci & JoJo – Don"t Rush
item.description: Casey (K.C.) & Jojo

item.title: Diego Ray – Superhero
item.description: Diego Ray is an Italian-American DJ and producer.

item.title: Denzil & Dwayne – Force Of Habit
item.description: Denzil & Dwayn is a project by Maykel Piron, a Dutch trance producer and one of the founders of Armada Music, and Michiel Van Der Kuy, a Dutch musician and music producer.

item.title: David Morales & Albert Cabrera Present Moca Featuring Deanna – Higher
item.description: “Higher” is a house track by David Morales and Albert Cabrera’s collaboration “Moca” featuring American vocalist Deanna. Also participating are John Conte (Bass), Cool Daddy (Guitar), Eric Kupper (Keys), Joey Mosk (Keys), David Sussman (Engineer), and Steve Barkan (Engineer).

item.title: DJ Dero – The Horn 2000
item.description: DJ Dero is a producer and DJ from Argentina.

item.title: Tignino & Leo Feat. Mark Kerr – How Can You Feel
item.description: An electro house track by Italian DJ/producer Daniele Tignino and Sicilian musician Ottavio Leo, featuring Mark Kerr, brother of Scottish rock band Simple Minds frontman Jim Kerr.

item.title: Oxia – Reflexion
item.description: A techno track by Olivier Raymond, also known as Oxia, a French DJ and producer who is one of the founders of GoodLife.

item.title: Surgeon – Dry
item.description: A techno track released in 1999 by British DJ and electronic musician Anthony Child, also known as Surgeon, from his label Dynamic Tension Records.

item.title: Surgeon – Communications
item.description: Surgeon”s first album was released in 1996 on the British label Downwards, founded by Regis and Female. This album was supported by JEFF MILLS and is said to be the breakthrough and masterpiece that made Surgeon”s name known to the world.

item.title: Small World – I Believe
item.description: Paul Hunter, also known as Small World, is a producer from Glasgow, Scotland, and the brother of Michael Hunter, who created the music for Grand Theft Auto IV and San Andreas. Paul Hunter also performs under the names Brother Of Soul, Dual Tone, Poets Of Thought, Second Crusade and The Stic.

item.title: McCarthy – Should The Bible Be Banned?
item.description: McCarthy was a British indie rock band that was active from 1985 to 1990. The members are Gary Baker on drums, Malcolm Eden on guitar and vocals, Tim Gane on lead guitar, and John Williamson on bass. After the band disbanded, Tim Gane and bank vocalist Laetitia Sadier formed Stereolab.

item.title: Danny Clark & ​​Jay Benham Featuring Carla Prather – Into You
item.description: A deep house/garage house track by UK house music producers Danny Clark & ​​Jay Benham, featuring vocal producer Carla Prather, who has collaborated with many artists such as MR. ALI, QUENTIN HARRIS, VICK LAVENDER, LOFTSOUL, and DJ SPEN.

item.title: DJ Savage – Greek Style E.P
item.description: DJ Savage is a veteran DJ and producer from Greece. “Greek Style E.P.” is a techno track released in 2001 on the UK label Contrast, founded by Marco Lenzi and Nils Hess.

item.title: Neztic – Kickin" Down
item.description: Manuel Neztic, also known as Neztic, is a DJ who has been active in the Mexican electronic music scene since 1998.

item.title: Mike Dearborn – No Communication
item.description: Mike Dearborn is a DJ from Chicago who runs Majesty Recordings.

item.title: MDC-X-Static – You And Me
item.description: The producers are Bingoboys, a DJ trio from Vienna made up of Klaus Biedermann, Paul Pfab, and Helmut Wolfgruber, who are famous for their song “How To Dance,” which became a club hit around the world in 1990.

item.title: Don Diablo – Casa Del Diablo
item.description: Don Diablo is a DJ, digital artist, and record producer from the Netherlands. He is known as one of the pioneers of the future house genre, a subgenre of EDM, and runs the Dutch house label HEXAGON.

item.title: Mercedes – Living For The Moment
item.description: A house/garage house track released in 1994 by Trinidad-born, UK-based singer Mercedes on Vinyl Solution, a UK label famous for producing Depth Charge, Eon, Bizarre Inc, and Andrew Meecham.

item.title: Tiësto & Junkie XL – Obsession
item.description: A remix of “Obsession” by Dutch DJ and producer Tiesto, who is said to be the godfather of the best DJ and EDM of the past 20 years, and Tom Holkenborg, also known as Junkie XL, who was a central figure in the 1990s big beat movement and a pioneer of the rock and dance crossover scene.

item.title: Oxia Vs The Hacker – GoodLife EP
item.description: Olivier Raymond, also known as Oxia, is a DJ and producer from France. Oxia was formed as a duo with Stephane Deschezeaux in the mid-‘90s, but later became Olivier Raymond’s solo project.

item.title: Mossa – Salt Peanuts EP
item.description: Jeremy Petrus, also known as Mossa, is a musician, DJ, and electronic music producer based in Montreal, Canada. He runs the label Complot Records, which releases music in a wide range of styles from techno to chill-out.

item.title: Metal Blade – Cannonball Metal Funk
item.description: Metal Blade is a project by Japanese techno DJ/producer Fumiaki Kobayashi and DJ/guitarist Masayuki Ozaki.

item.title: Mark & ​​John – Jagging (Remixes)
item.description: Mark & ​​John is a project by Swedish DJ and house producer John Dahlbäck and Mark O’Sullivan, who is part of the unit DK7 with Jesper Dahlbäck. John Dahlbäck and Jesper Dahlbäck are cousins ​​and collaborate under the names Hugg & Pepp and Pepp & Kaliber.

item.title: Marmion – Schöneberg Part2
item.description: Marmion is a trance techno project from Germany by Mijk Van Dijk and Marcos López.

item.title: Mark" Oh – Tears Don"t Lie
item.description: “Tears Don”t Lie” is a signature song by German DJ and producer Marko Albrecht, known as Mark’ Oh. This song is a rework of Michael Holm”s “When A Child Is Born,” which was a huge hit in Germany in 1974.

item.title: MC Miker G – Big House (We"ve Got The Juice)
item.description: Dutch rapper Lucien Witteveen, known as MC Miker G, was one of the first generation of Dutch rappers, active since 1984. In 1986, MC Miker G released “Holiday Rap” as MC Miker G. & DJ Sven, which became a worldwide hit.

item.title: J. Max – Cosmic
item.description: A techno-Italo house track released in 1990 by the Italian techno label Vrs in the early 1990s. Composer: Giancarlo Ragni, producer: Graziano Ragni, owner of V.R.S. (Vallemania Recording Studios).

item.title: DJ T. – Radiator Robot Riot4
item.description: Thomas Koch, aka DJ T., also known as Mathami, is a German DJ and producer. He has been active as a DJ since the 1980s, serving as a resident DJ at Frankfurt clubs such as Music Hall, Plastik, Dorian Gray, XS, and The Box.In 1989, he founded Groove magazine and ran it until 2004. Since 2002, he has been active as a member of Get Physical Music.

item.title: DJ Quicksilver – Cosmophobia
item.description: DJ Quicksilver is a German-Turkish producer and DJ. Representative songs include “Bellissima” and “Ameno”. He also works as a remixer for Ian van Dahl, Faithless, and The Verve.

item.title: Binary Finary – 2000
item.description: Binary Finary is a UK trance music duo formed by Matt Rankin and Stuart Matheson. They were active in the 1990s and released many songs that are known as trance classics.

item.title: Unity – Work It Out
item.description: Unity is a project by Gary Storm and Lionel Herman. He also works under other names as Power Movement, Rugged All-Stars, S.N.H. Foundation, and Storm & Herman.

item.title: Ultra Naté – Found A Cure
item.description: Ultra Nate is an American singer-songwriter, producer, and DJ known for hit songs such as “Free,” “If You Could Read My Mind,” and “Automatic.”

item.title: Reality – Yolanda
item.description: Reality is a hip house trio whose vocals are Afrika Bambaataa’s cousin Kool Rock Steady, aka Edward Rudolph.

item.title: R.B.M. Featuring A Freakin Rican – I Got U Now
item.description: Released in 1994 on the house label Strictly Rhythm, “I Got U Now” is a house track by house music producer Ralphie “Boy” Muniz, aka R.B.M., and Ed Quiroz, aka A Freakin Rican.

item.title: Photon, Inc. – Project Blast
item.description: Photon, Inc. is the alias of Chicago-born DJ and producer DJ Pierre.

item.title: Morel – Morel's Grooves Part 9 - The Remixes
item.description: George Morel, also known as Morel, is a New York DJ and record producer who is said to be one of the central figures in New York’s garage house scene in the early 1990s.

item.title: Children Circle – Indonesia Mamba Mama
item.description: Circle Children is one of the aliases of US DJ and producer Armand Van Helden.

item.title: Aly-Us – Time Passes On Go On
item.description: Aly-Us is a house music group from New Jersey that was active in the early 1990s. The trio consists of Eddie L. Lewis (also known as Supa), DJ Kyle “Small” Smith, and William Brian Jennings.

item.title: Stretch & Vern Present Maddog – I"m Alive
item.description: Stretch & Vern is a unit of house music DJ/producer duo Stuart Silvester (aka Stretch Silvester) and Julian Peake (aka Jules Vern) from London. He also performs under other names as EL B’s, Essenvee, Maddog, Phender, The Moonmen, and Wide Mouth.

item.title: Starchild – Something New
item.description: Starchild is a trance DJ and producer also known as Alici and DJ Alici.

item.title: Ize & L.P. – Sex Talk (Wanting You) Ay Baby
item.description: This is an EP by Ize & L.P. released in 1993 on the long-established US label Strictly Rhythm.

item.title: Wildlife – Hooked On Dope E.P.
item.description: Seb Fontaine, also known as Wildlife, is a DJ and producer from the UK. He has been a resident DJ at venues such as The Fridge and Cream, and has released numerous mix albums.

item.title: Reel 2 Real Featuring Mad Stuntman – Go On Move / I'm The Mad Stuntman
item.description: Reel 2 Real is an American hip house music project active in the 1990s.

item.title: Nicole Lamons – I Think You"re Gonna Like It
item.description: A house/deep house/garage house track released in 1993 by New York house label Strictly Rhythm.

item.title: Maurice – Got Me Burning Up
item.description: Maurice (King Maurice) is DJ Pierre’s younger brother, and the two of them are also known as The Wild Pitch Brothers.

item.title: Djaimin – Give You
item.description: Djaimin is a top Swiss DJ and producer. A legend in the Swiss house scene, he was a resident at Montreux’s Platinum Club in the 1980s and was one of the first DJs to perform live house music on Swiss radio station Couleur 3. He was also active as the unit Black & White Brothers with Mr. Mike.

item.title: KGB – KGB
item.description: KGB was a 1970s blues-rock group featuring American and British musicians Ray Kennedy, Rick Grech, Mike Bloomfield, Carmine Appice, and Barry Goldberg.

item.title: Formologic – Symphonic Language
item.description: Ronald Van Gelderen, also known as Formologic, is a trance DJ and producer from the Netherlands. Also known as Kid Vicious, he has also released under the names N-Fluence, Electronics, and Masai.

item.title: Eve Gallagher – Love Is A Master Of Disguise
item.description: Eve Gallagher is a house music singer from the UK.

item.title: The Mars Volta – Amputechture
item.description: The Mars Volta is a US progressive rock band formed by former ATDI member Cedric Bixler and Omar Rodriguez. Active from 2001 to 2013. His style is a mix of various genres, including emo, culimo, dub, techno, Latin, salsa, and improvisation.

item.title: Winger – Winger
item.description: Winger is an American rock band formed in New York in 1987. Winger released two platinum albums in the late 1980s and early 1990s, ““Winger” and ““In the Heart of the Young.” In 1990, they were nominated for “Best New Heavy Metal Band” at the American Music Awards.

item.title: Bad Religion – The New America
item.description: Bad Religion is a punk rock band formed in Los Angeles, and is a leading figure in modern punk rock, known as one of the groups that created the melodic hardcore style.

item.title: Ricardo vs. Jay – Fenlow
item.description: A house minimal track by Ricardo Villalobos, a heavyweight in the minimal techno world, and DJ Jay Haze, a US-born German-based producer.

item.title: Strip Steve – Skip School EP
item.description: A techno house track released on Boysnoize Records in 2007 by Strip Steve, a French DJ and producer who also works as a support DJ for Boys Noize. “You & I”, included in the album, is Strip Steve’s signature song and became a huge hit. He also works under other names as CAPTCHA and Théo Pozoga.

item.title: Pseudonym – You Have The Right To Remain Silent
item.description: The producers are British DJ/producer Ian Levine and high-energy producer Steven Wagner. Ian Levine modernizes UK Northern soul music and is also known as the creator of the Hi NRG style.

item.title: Nu Shooz – Poolside
item.description: Nu Shooz is a pop, Latin, freestyle, and electronic dance music duo based in Portland, Oregon, USA, formed by husband and wife duo John Smith and Valerie Day.

item.title: Spacetime Continuum – Emit Ecaps
item.description: A double LP set released in 1996 by Jonah Sharp, also known as Spacetime Continuum, a stalwart of the underground techno/ambient/electronica scene of the 90s, on his own label Reflective Records.

item.title: Fumio Miyashita - Meisou
item.description: Tomio Miyashita is a musician, music therapist, and synthesizer player from Nagano Prefecture.

item.title: Blues Explosion – Extra Width
item.description: The Jon Spencer Blues Explosion was a three-piece rock band from New York that was active from 1991 to 2016. Their style is based on rock and combines elements of punk, blues, garage, rockabilly, soul, noise rock, rhythm and blues, and hip-hop.

item.title: 8bit Project – Familiar Computing World
item.description: 8bit Project is a Japanese techno-pop chiptune unit that made its CD debut in 2006. The members are Shunji Ito, Hisashi Saito, Hironori Tokaibayashi, and Yosuke Kinoshita. He has Hideki Matsutake, chairman of the Japan Synthesizer Programmers Association (JSPA), as his ““guardian.’’

item.title: Ziggy – No Police (Aztec Remix)
item.description: “No Police” is a high-energy track composed and produced by Christoff Wybouw, also known as Serge Gobin, who is known as a member of Belgian new beat project J.C. Project, The Beast, and War People. Christoff Wybouw is famous for ““Arabeat,’’ released under the alias Bingo!.

item.title: Wid & Ben – Abs0lut1on F0r N1ne
item.description: Wid & Ben is a hard trance unit formed by Andrew Widdop and Ben Thomas.

item.title: The Huggy Factor – Ass Jam
item.description: The Huggy Factor is a unit of Carl Finlow and Paul Huggett, who also work under the names Silicon Scally, Random Factor, Voice Stealer, Il.Ek.Tro, and Scarletron, and are co-founders of 2020 Vision.

item.title: T99 – Anasthasia
item.description: T99 was a Belgian duo active in the late 80”s and early 90”s. T99 was originally Patrick De Meyer’s solo project, but T99 became a Patrick De Meyer and Olivier Abbeloos recording after Patrick heard Olivier Abbeloos’ song ““Anasthasia’’ and suggested that Abbeloos release it as T99.

item.title: Sugababes – Shape
item.description: Sugababes is a British female pop group formed in 1998 by the manager of All Saints.

item.title: Richard Strauss
item.description: ・Conductor: Otto Ackermann ・Horn [solo]: Dennis Brain Dennis Brain ・Orchestra: Philharmonia Orchestra ・Soprano vocal: Elisabeth Schwarzkopf

item.title: Oregano – Oregano
item.description: Although the mix title is not listed, “Oregano by Oregano” is a deep house track by Todd Terry released on Freeze Records in 1994.

item.title: Kitaro – Astral Trip
item.description: Kitaro played keyboards as a member of the Japanese progressive rock band “Far East Family Band” in the early 1970s. While visiting Europe to record with his band, he met German synthesizer player Klaus Schulze, and became interested in synthesizers.

item.title: Inkfish – Acting Out
item.description: Inkfish, a heavyweight in the underground house scene, is a producer and DJ collective that has been active since the 90s. The members are Mattias Lindblom, Jesper Lindquist, Andreas Hermansson and Johan Hermansson from Sweden.

item.title: Ike & Tina Turner – The Hunter
item.description: Ike & Tina Turner were an American R&B/soul duo active in the 1960s and 1970s. He has worked on a wide range of music styles including rock, soul, blues, funk, and funk rock.

item.title: Fable – When He"s Gone (Ain"t No Sunshine)
item.description: Gez Dewar, also known as Fable, is a music/TV producer from the UK. Also known as Heliotropic, a unit with Nick Hale.

item.title: Ella Fitzgerald – I Got The Rhythm
item.description: Ella Fitzgerald was an American jazz singer who was also known as ““The First Lady of Song” and ““Lady Ella.” One of the top female jazz vocalists of the 20th century, along with Billie Holiday and Sarah Vaughan.

item.title: Del Costa & Pedro Goya – Freaky Mike
item.description: An electro-tech house track by the great duo of Pedro Goya and Del Costa, two heavyweights in the Portuguese electronic music world who have released numerous works on famous labels such as Yoyaku, Ubiyu, Different Heads, and Classic Music Company.

item.title: Cubic 22 – Night In Motion
item.description: Cubic 22 is a dance music project by Belgian producers Peter Ramson and Danny Van Wauwe who started their activities in the early 1990s, during the burgeoning period of the UK house music scene. Peter Ramson and Danny Van Wauwe have released their work under various aliases, including Set Up System.

item.title: Ween – Pure Guava
item.description: Released in 1992, “Pure Guava” is Ween”s third studio album and major label debut. Contains Ween”s masterpiece “Push th’ Little Daisies”.

item.title: New Order – Substance
item.description: New Order is a UK rock band whose predecessor was Joy Division, one of the most representative post-punk bands.

item.title: Adam Clayton & Larry Mullen – Theme From Mission: Impossible
item.description: Cassette tape of the theme song for the movie “Mission: Impossible” by U2 members Adam Clayton and Larry Mullen, released in 1996.

item.title: Music of John Blow
item.description: Music by John Blow Conductor – Gustav Leonhardt

item.title: Brian Eno & John Cale – Wrong Way Up
item.description: A promotional cassette tape for Brian Eno and John Cale’s studio album “Wrong Way Up” released in 1990.

item.title: Best Of Kitaro
item.description: Kitaro, a Japanese keyboardist and synthesizer player, won the Golden Globe Award for Best Original Score in 1994 for Oliver Stone’s film Heaven & Earth. In 2001, it won the 43rd Grammy Award for Best New Age Album.

item.title: The Soft Machine – The Soft Machine
item.description: The Soft Machine is a British progressive jazz-rock band from Canterbury formed in mid-1966 by Mike Rutledge, Robert Wyatt, Kevin Ayers, David Allen, and Larry Nowlin. The band was named after William S. Burroughs’ novel ““The Soft Machine’’.

item.title: The Heptones – On Top
item.description: The Heptones were a Jamaican rocksteady and reggae vocal trio that was most active in the 1960s and early 1970s.

item.title: Sum 41 – Does This Look Infected?
item.description: “Does This Look Infected?”, released in 2002, is Sum41’s second studio album.

item.title: E-Rotic – Sexual Madness
item.description: E-Rotic is a Eurodance duo group formed in 1994 by German record producer David Brandes. The members are German singer Lyane Leigh (Liane Hegemann) and American rapper Richard Allen Smith (Ras-Ma-Taz).

item.title: Dry & Heavy – From Creation
item.description: Dry&Heavy is a Japanese reggae dub band formed in 1991 by drummer Shigeki Nanao (Dry) and bassist Takeshi Akimoto (Heavy). Dry&Heavy’s sound is influenced by 1970s Jamaican dub sounds such as King Tubby and Lee Perry, and they have been successful at reggae and dub festivals both domestically and internationally.

item.title: Deaz D Featuring DJ Fish – Dark En'Trance
