item.description: Deaz D (Dennis Harinck) is a resident DJ at the Dutch club Locomotion (-2002) and a hardcore producer who is famous as a member of the Bitte-Ein-Beat crew. DJ Norman, who is active in the hardcore scene with DJ Gizmo, is his own brother.

item.title: Adam Beyer & Henrik B – Heat Wombing
item.description: Adam Beyer is a Swedish techno producer and DJ from Stockholm. He has released numerous techno tracks on labels such as Drumcode Records, Mad Eye Recordings, and Truesoul Records.

item.title: VA – Disco Sound Special Vol. 1
item.description: VA – Disco Sound Special Vol. 1 - Disco Sound Special 2-disc record set

item.title: Thomas Newman – Scent Of A Woman
item.description: Tracks A1-A6, A8-A10, B1-B2, and B4-B7 were composed by American composer Thomas Newman. Thomas Newman has created scores for numerous films, including The Shawshank Redemption, American Beauty, The Green Mile, Finding Nemo, Wall-E, Skyfall, and Specter.

item.title: Dale Scott – You Bring Me Joy
item.description: “You Bring Me Joy” is a deep house and garage house track released in 1994 on the New York label JoJo Records.

item.title: The Gabby Pahinui Hawaiian Band – Gabby Band Volume 2
item.description: “Gabby Band Volume 2” is the fourth album released in 1977 by Gabby Pahinui, a slack key guitarist and vocalist representing Hawaiian music and a central figure in the Hawaiian Renaissance of the 1970s, with the band known as Gabby Band since 1972.

item.title: Schawkie Roth – Dance Of The Tao
item.description: Considered one of the pioneers of New Age spiritual music, Schawkie Roth is a composer specializing in healing, meditation, relaxation music, and acoustic jazz.

item.title: Mouse On The Keys – An Anxious Object
item.description: Mouse On The Keys was formed in 2006 by former members of the post-hardcore/post-rock band Nine Days Wonder, Akira Kawasaki (drums, piano) and Atsushi Kiyota (piano, keyboards), and became a trio in 2007 with the addition of Daisuke Niidome (piano, keyboards). Mouse On The Keys is characterized by a unique style that fuses jazz, funk, post-rock, and electronic music.

item.title: Carabao – Made In Thailand Vol.5
item.description: Carabao, formed in the Philippines in 1982 by Yuanyong Opakul (also known as Aed) and Kirati Promsaka Na Sakon Nakhon, is a Thai rock band that is very popular in Thailand and other Asian countries.

item.title: Cajun Dance Party – The Colorful Life
item.description: Cajun Dance Party is a five-piece rock band from London, England.

item.title: Various – Build & Destroy (The Best Of Mo Wax Recordings)
item.description: A two-disc compilation album released in 1996 by MO WAX, a legendary label representing the 90s.

item.title: The PreC.I.S.E. MC – PreC.I.S.E.-ly Done
item.description: The PreC.I.S.E. MC is female MC Marcella Brailsford from Brooklyn, New York. He is also a member of the group Twise with Tika Sumpter.

item.title: Masterboy – Different Dreams
item.description: Masterboy, active since 1990, is a German Eurodance project that is best known in Europe.

item.title: Masterboy – Colors
item.description: Masterboy, led by Tommy Schleh and Enrico Zabler, is Europe’s best-known euro dance group, releasing a series of worldwide hit songs in the 90s. They were active from 1990 to 2004, took a hiatus, and resumed their activities in 2013.

item.title: Kimusawea – Kurze Abhandlung Vom Menschen Und Seinem Glück
item.description: Kimusawea is a hardcore/post-hardcore/experimental band formed by Alexandra Petrović and Hajo Greif from Frankfurt, Germany. Although the band disbanded in 1998, Alexandra Petrović went on to be a member of the German experimental grindcore/metal band Bolz’n from 2003 to 2007, and as a member of Idiot Switch from 2007.

item.title: Ennio Morricone – Nuovo Cinema Paradiso (Musica Originale Del Film)
item.description: Soundtrack for the 1989 film ““New Cinema Paradise’’ composed by Italian composer Ennio Morricone. The CD that made Ennio Morricone famous.

item.title: Emergency – Let Me Be
item.description: Emergency is an Italo dance project by Alessandro Carino, Graziano Fanelli, Jose Antonio Manzano, Marco Rizzi, and Pieradis Rossini.

item.title: Bazz-Dee & Waldhaus Weichentechnikk – Brachial 200404
item.description: The first track on side A is a techno track that samples KISS’s “I Was Made For Loving You” by Waldhaus and Bazz-Dee (Bastian Schubert), who are considered to be one of the innovators of the hard techno sound, with a style that boldly combines hard techno and industrial hardcore.

item.title: Steve Reid – Bamboo Forest
item.description: Steve Reid is an American jazz percussionist and producer. He was a co-founder of The Rippingtons and a member of Supertramp.

item.title: Mooncoin – Mooncoin
item.description: Mooncoin is a duo formed by Mickie Zekley and Michael Hubbert, whose style is a combination of Irish music, Celtic music, and British music.

item.title: Koivun Kaiku – Keepers
item.description: “Keepers”, released in 1987, is folk and world music played by the kantele, a Finnish folk instrument and a type of plucked string instrument in the zither family.

item.title: Imbaya – Un Paso A La Eternidad
item.description: Imbaya is a Bolivian trio that plays traditional South American music based on flute and guitar, with occasional vocals. The members are Jaime Vega, Carlos Vega & Mario Vega, who play instruments of Andean culture such as the quena, quenacho, flauta de pan (pan flute), and sampona.

item.title: Deep Forest – 2 Song Sampler
item.description: Deep Forest is a French group consisting of Eric Mouquet and Michel Sanchez.

item.title: Amany & The Badawist – Come on, Bassem
item.description: “Come on, Bassem” is a cassette tape released by the Lebanese label Badawist Phone. Angel Nabil Ayyoub, also known as Amany, is a dancer and choreographer from Lebanon.

item.title: Ancient Future – Natural Rhythms
item.description: Ancient Future is a world fusion music group formed in 1978 by Matthew Montfort, who is considered one of the 100 greatest acoustic guitarists in the world.

item.title: Unknown Artist – Gamelan Music Of Bali
item.description: A Balinese gamelan music album released by the label Lyrichord.

item.title: Toni Childs – Union
item.description: Toni Childs is a Grammy-nominated singer-songwriter.

item.title: No Artist – Environments (New Concepts In Stereo Sound) (Cassette Two)
item.description: One of the songs released by the American label Atlantic in the 1970s as part of the Syntonic Research Series. As the title “Environments” suggests, this is soothing relaxation music based on field recordings.

item.title: Ladysmith Black Mambazo – Shaka Zulu
item.description: Founded in 1964 by Joseph Shabalala, Ladysmith Black Mambazo is a South African male choral group that sings in the isikatamiya (traditional Zulu music) and Mbube style.

item.title: Tree Spirit – Tree Spirit
item.description: Tree Spirit is a group from California. The high-energy, earth-loving band has a unique style they call “earth rock,” which is a fusion of rock, folk, and psychedelic.

item.title: Marcin Czubala – I Can Make You Dance EP
item.description: Marcin Czubala is a minimal techno DJ and producer from Poland with a background in classical music. Since 2007, he has been a member of the Berlin-based German techno/house label MOBILEE.

item.title: E-Rotic – Willy Use A Billy... Boy
item.description: E-Rotic is a German techno-pop dance unit that has been active since 1994. The founding members were German-born vocalist Lyane Leigh and American rapper Richard Michael Smith, known as Raz-Ma-Taz.

item.title: De"Lacy – Hideaway
item.description: De”Lacy is a 1990s US house music group. Members are De”Lacy Davis, Gary Griffin, Glen Branch, and Rainie Lassiter. “Hideaway” is De”Lacy”s signature song.

item.title: Kronos Quartet – Monk Suite Kronos Quartet Plays Music Of Thelonious Monk
item.description: Kronos Quartet is a string quartet formed in Seattle in 1973 by violinist David Harrington, and has been based in San Francisco since 1978.

item.title: Harry Connick, Jr. – We Are In Love
item.description: Harry Connick, Jr. is a singer and pianist from New Orleans. He composed the music for the 1989 film ““Lovers’ Premonition” and has also been active as an actor since the 1990s, appearing in ““Memphis Belle” and ““Independence Day.’’

item.title: Bob Marley – Soul Almighty – The Formative Years Vol. 1
item.description: A remastered work that mixes the original vocals recorded by Bob Marley and the Wailers in Jamaica between 1967 and 1968, with studio instrumental tracks and production from around 1995 and 1996.

item.title: Nirvana – Nevermind
item.description: Nirvana is a US rock band known as a pioneer of alternative rock and grunge. “Nevermind” is Nirvana’s second album and was a huge hit, reaching number one on the Billboard. The success of this album sparked the grunge/alternative rock movement in America.

item.title: Miles Davis – Originals / Moods
item.description: One of Miles Davis’ four-cassette compilations released in 1988. The tape is chrome tape.

item.title: Miles Davis – Blues/Standards
item.description: One of Miles Davis’ four-cassette compilations released in 1988. The tape is chrome tape.

item.title: Marvin Gaye – I Heard It Through The Grapevine
item.description: “I Heard It Through The Grapevine” is the eighth studio album by soul musician Marvin Gaye.

item.title: Devo – New Traditionalists
item.description: “New Traditionalists” is the fourth album by US new wave band Devo, released in 1981, and the band’s first completely self-produced album.

item.title: Cactus World News – Urban Beaches
item.description: Cactus World News is an Irish rock band formed in Dublin in April 1984. In 1985, he toured the UK with the UK hard rock band The Cult and signed a contract with MCA Records.

item.title: Various – Resonance Mood
item.description: MATSURI PRODUCTIONS is a UK goa trance label founded in 1994 by DJ TSUYOSHI and John Perloff.

item.title: Various – Overnight Remixes II
item.description: Euro house, techno, new beat, garage house compilation album from the late 80”s to the 90”s.

item.title: Various – Metal For Muthas
item.description: [Recording artists] Iron Maiden, Sledgehammer, E.F. Band, Toad the Wet Sprocket, Aether the Frog, Angel Witch, Samson, Nuds

item.title: Ursula 1000 – Here Comes Tomorrow
item.description: Alex Gimeno, also known as Ursula 1000, a New York producer and lounge DJ, has established a unique style that he calls retro/future sound by fusing diverse sounds such as 60”s soundtracks, 90”s lounge revival, Shibuya-kei, British big beat, funk, and disco.

item.title: Kinka – Prayer / Burnin'
item.description: Takaya Hayakawa, also known as Kinka, has been a DJ, sound composer, organizer, and music producer since the late 1980s. Kinka is also active as the unit KEY OF KNOWLEDGE with ZEEKO, and the units MONKA and acca with JUZU a.k.a. MOOCHY.

item.title: Genghis Khan – Greatest Hits
item.description: Genghis Khan is a German disco group formed by Ralph Siegel. He competed in Eurovision in 1979 and came in 4th place.

item.title: D.O.M. – Acid War (Liberator DJs RMX)
item.description: D.O.M. is a duo consisting of Jon Nuccle, one of the pioneers of UK techno music, and Mike Humphries, a techno producer who has been active since the early 90’s. The two also work under the names Area 51, Cold Dust, and Drone.

item.title: Armand Van Helden Featuring Duane Harden – You Don't Know Me
item.description: “You Don’t Know Me” by Armand Van Helden and Duane Harden is a best-selling dance single and club hit house track that topped the UK Singles Chart in January 1999.

item.title: Aleph – Fire On The Moon
item.description: Aleph was a 1980s Italo disco band featuring vocals by Dave Rogers. Other members are Donato Bellini and Marco Manzi.

item.title: Ugra & Albrecht – Retouched EP
item.description: Ugra & Albrecht is a project by German techno DJs and producers Sertac Ugra and Sören Albrecht.

item.title: The Explorers – Venus De Milo
item.description: The Explorers are a group formed by former members of the progressive rock band Roxy Music, Phil Manzanera and Andy MacKay, with James Wraith on vocals.

item.title: Bah Samba – Album Sampler
item.description: Bah Samba was formed in 1996 by Julian Bendall, Kevin Alexander, and Geoff Holroyd.

item.title: Spiral Life – Freaks Of Go Go Spectators 2
item.description: Spiral Life is a music unit composed of Koji Kurumatani and Shokichi Ishida. Active period: 1993-1996.

item.title: Schubert – Don't Believe The Chord-Pop Hype
item.description: A minimal techno track by Leipzig-based German techno producer Schubert aka Matthias Kretzschmar.

item.title: Santana – Caravanserai
item.description: Santana is an American Latin rock group formed in the late 1960s led by guitarist Carlos Santana.

item.title: Kaskade – Everything
item.description: Ryan Gary Raddon, also known as Kaskade, is a US DJ, producer, and remixer. Kaskade was named America”s Best DJ by DJ Times in 2011 and 2013, and was ranked #51 on DJ Mag”s 2009 Top 100 DJs list.

item.title: Jean-Michel Bernard – The Science Of Sleep
item.description: Soundtrack for the movie ““Sleep in Love,’’ written and directed by Michel Gondry, who has worked on music videos for Björk, The Chemical Brothers, Daft Punk, Radiohead, and more.

item.title: Carl Craig – Landcruising
item.description: Carl Craig is a member of the second generation of Detroit techno, discovered by Derrick May, who is known as one of the founders of Detroit techno along with Kevin Saunderson and Juan Atkins.

item.title: Zombie Nation – Souls At Zero
item.description: Zombie Nation became famous with the release of ““Kernkraft 400’’ in 1999.

item.title: YMO – Rydeen
item.description: A 7-inch album released by Yellow Magic Orchestra (YMO) on the Alfa label in 1980.

item.title: Space Frog – X-Ray (Follow Me) - Remixes
item.description: A trance track by Cet Merlin, also known as Space Frog, a hard trance/trance DJ from Berlin, Germany.

item.title: Marco Bailey – Play It Back
item.description: Marco Bailey is a producer and DJ from Belgium. He runs the label PORNOGRAPHIC with his own label Session Recordings and Cristian Varela.

item.title: Kinderzimmer Productions – Doobie
item.description: Kinderzimmer Productions is a hip-hop band formed in the mid-1990s by Quasi Modo (Sascha Klammt, DJ) and Textor (Henrik von Holtum, MC) from Ulm, Germany.

item.title: Dollar Brand – Ancient Africa
item.description: A post-bop album released by South African pianist and composer Abdullah Ibrahim, also known as Dollar Brand, on Trio Records in 1974.

item.title: B. Brothers – Rockollection
item.description: Italo dance track by Italian producers Marcello Catalano and Roberto Zucchini, who created many works in the 90’s.

item.title: Atrium – Jolly Joker
item.description: Atrium is an Italo disco/Eurobeat project.

item.title: Armand Van Helden – My My My (Remixes)
item.description: A collection of remixes of “My My My” from Armand Van Helden’s album “New York: A Mix Odyssey”.

item.title: White Light Circus – Marching Orders
item.description: Dean Meredith, also known as White Light Circus, is a UK DJ and producer who is also active as the unit Chicken Lips with Andy Meecham.

item.title: Troy Pierce – 25 Bitches Vol. I
item.description: Troy Pierce is an American electronic music DJ and producer based in Berlin.

item.title: Simone Fedi – Belzebu Tales
item.description: Simone Fedi is an Italian musician and producer.

item.title: Peej – Becoming Cosmic
item.description: A house/deep house track by Paul Johnston, also known as Peej.

item.title: DNS – Lucid Journey
item.description: DNS is a unit by D Lewis and Stuart B.

item.title: Clan Greco – Brassisity
item.description: Clan Greco is a unit formed by Ricky Rinaldi, producer and co-producer of Neffa e Sud Sound System, DJ Rodriguez, Bossa Nostra, Gazzara, etc., and Italian trumpet player Massimo Greco.

item.title: Steve Angello – Voices
item.description: Steve Angello is a Greek-Swedish DJ, record producer, and remixer.

item.title: Robbie Craig – 15 Candles
item.description: “15 Candles / L.O.V.E. Feeling” is a UK garage track by East17 vocalist (2014-) Robbie Craig.

item.title: RYU – Never Too Soon
item.description: RYU is an abstract hip hop/trip hop group consisting of DJ Hide, DJ Sak, and Hideaki Ishi (DJ Krush).

item.title: Quartz – The Calling EP
item.description: Quartz (Adriano Filippucci) is an Italian DJ and producer. The Calling is a techno track released in 2002 on the Montreal-based tech-trance label Ascend Recordings.

item.title: Orquesta De La Luz – De La Luz
item.description: "”De La Luz’’ is the debut album by the salsa band Orquesta de la Luz, released in 1990.

item.title: DMX Krew – Showroom Dummies
item.description: DMX Krew (Ed Upton) EP released in 1998 on the German label International Deejay Gigolo Records.

item.title: Brent Lewis – Earth Tribe Rhythms
item.description: Brent Lewis is a percussionist and drummer who has played with many famous artists over the years.

item.title: Modjo - Chillin"
item.description: “Modjo - Chillin’” is a song released in 2001 by the French duo Modjo. This song is included on their self-titled debut album Modjo.

item.title: Visionaries – If You Can't Say Love Domakesaythink
item.description: Visionaries is a six-piece conscious hip-hop group based in Los Angeles, formed in 1995.

item.title: Rude Solo Craig Walsh – Voodoo 2
item.description: Rude Solo is the project of Andrew Weatherall and Keith Tenniswood, also known as the electronic music duo Two Lone Swordsmen.

item.title: Bad Pimps – Give It
item.description: Bad Pimps is a project between Patrick Lindsey, one of the founders of the label Kanzleramt, and Stanny Franssen (aka. G-Force), one of the leading artists of the Belgian techno scene.

item.title: Rebus Tape – Drug Shaping EP
item.description: Rebus Tape is the solo unit of Shiro Nakajima, a member of the breakbeat unit Phab Com Masters.

item.title: Quadrophonia – The Wave Of The Future
item.description: Quadrophonia is a project by Dutch DJ Lucien Foort and Belgian DJ Olivier Abbeloos.

item.title: Sugababes – Soul Sound
item.description: The first B-side of Sugar Babes’ EP ““Soul Sound’’ is a remix by Dave Lee, aka Joey Negro, a UK DJ and house music producer also known as Jakatta, Doug Willis, Raven Maize, and Sessomatto.

item.title: D'Malicious – The Loup-Garou EP
item.description: A tech house track by Stockholm-based DJ, producer, and multi-instrumentalist Mikael Nordgren, aka D’Malicious.

item.title: Weirdo – Normalization
item.description: Hard trance was released in 2002 by British hard trance producer Dominic Harding, also known as Weirdo, on Tinrib Recordings, a label run by British hard house/NRG/hard trance producer Jon Bell.

item.title: Soul Unit – Cassanova
item.description: The soul unit”s EP “Casanova” includes a Latin hip-hop track produced by The Pharcyde”s track maker Spaceboy Boogie X.

item.title: Savier – Cucú
item.description: “Cucú” is a Euro house track by 90’s Italian Latin house act Savier.

item.title: S.U.M.O. – Samba Consumo
item.description: S.U.M.O., consisting of Alf Tumble and Magnus Rydén, stands for Swedish Underfed Music Operators.

item.title: Noisia – Yellow Brick Raar
item.description: Noisia is a Dutch drum and bass trio that disbanded in 2022. He produces a wide range of music including drum”n”bass, house, breaks, and electronic sounds, and in 2014 he also worked on the remix of LOST CHILD, which was included in Momoiro Clover Z”s “Furious Space Symphony - 7th Movement “Infinite Love’ (Emperor Style)”.

item.title: Stellar Project Feat. Brandi Emma – Get Up Stand Up
item.description: Stellar Project is a house/dance project by Italian producer Stefano Sorrentino.

item.title: Spork – Freek Like Me
item.description: A progressive house track released under the name Spork by UK producer J.P. Davies (Deejay Punk-Roc), who has remixed Korn, Pitchshifter, and Kurtis Mantronik.

item.title: Spiros Kaloumenos – Rock It
item.description: A techno track released on MB Elektronics in 2006 by Greek techno DJ Spiros Kaloumenos, who is part of the Marco Bailey family active in the Spanish minimal techno scene and runs Omega Audio Recordings with techno DJ Axel Karakasis.

item.title: Sound Associates – Rock The Beat Slipstream
item.description: A techno track released by Sound Associates, a unit consisting of DJ Daz Saund and Ben Tisdall, who are active in the UK techno scene, on the Belgian techno label Music Man Records in 1999.

item.title: Sisqo – Thong Song (Remix)
item.description: Sisqo [Mark Andrews Profile] is an R&B singer from East Baltimore, Maryland.

item.title: Shazz + StGermain Feat. Derek Bays – Muse Q The Music
item.description: A house/deep house track by French record producer/remixer Shazz and House&Nu Jazz musician StGermain.

item.title: Rebecca – Cheap Hippies
item.description: “CHEAP HIPPIES” is Rebecca’s third 12-inch single released in 1987.

item.title: Motion Detector – Motion Detector
item.description: A house dub track by Motion Detector released in 2002 by the American label Losonofono Records.

item.title: Various – Mod.Cooperate.Two
item.description: A minimal techno glitch electro house compilation by Nisios, Trike, Metaboman, and Dubnoodles released in 2004 on Milnor Modern, the German techno label founded by Treplec.

item.title: The Dave Howard Singers – Rock On
item.description: The Dave Howard Singers are a cult alternative rock band/project formed in Toronto, Canada.

item.title: Sunseeker Feat. Crystal Waters – Nights In Egypt
item.description: Featured Crystal Waters is a house vocalist born in Deptford Township, New Jersey in 1961.

item.title: Steve Mac vs. Mosquito Feat. Steve Smith –Lovin' You More (That Big Track)
item.description: A house track by UK house producer Steve Mac and Steve Smith, who is active in the UK house trio Mosquito, Dirty Vegas, and Squeeze, who are also famous in the psytrance scene.

item.title: South Central – Nothing Can Go Wrong
item.description: “Nothing Can Go Wrong” is a glitch electro track by South Central, a DJ duo from Brighton, UK, released in 2007 on the UK independent label A/G/P.

item.title: Santessa – Eyes On You
item.description: “Eyes On You” by Santessa was released on the label Disco Volante in 2000.

item.title: Samuel L – Day n' Night
item.description: Samuel L is a Swedish tribal techno DJ and producer. “Day n’ Night” is a techno track released in 2001 from SSL, which he runs.

item.title: Monette Evans – (This Is) The Time (Remix)
item.description: Monette Evans’ single “(This Is) The Time (Remix)” was produced by Mosaic, a Eurohouse trance project founded by Sven Väth, Matthias Hoffmann, and Steffen Britzke.

item.title: Elektrochemie LK – When I Rock
item.description: A techno track released in 2001 by German techno heavyweight Thomas Schumacher under the name Elektrochemie LK.

item.title: CCP – Hard Work
item.description: CCP is a group consisting of Chris Hilbert, David Palmer, and Peter Chapman.

item.title: Auto Repeat – Auto-Amerikanische Freundschaft (Revisited Remixed)
item.description: A house techno track released in 1995 by Alexander Müller, also known as Auto Repeat.

item.title: Zed Bias – Ambush Riddim Cosmic Minefield
item.description: Zed Bias, also known as Dave Jones, is a Manchester-based UK electronic musician, UK garage, 2-step, broken beat, and UK funky producer and DJ.

item.title: The Brothers Johnson – Kick It To The Curb
item.description: The Brothers Johnson is an American soul/funk/jazz/disco band. Formed in Los Angeles, California in 1975, the group is led by brothers George and Louis Johnson. Early members included his cousin Alex Ware.

item.title: Steve Stoll - Pieces Of Eight
item.description: A techno track released in 2000 by US techno and ambient DJ/producer Steve Stoll.

item.title: Slam Inc Hard Kor – Pig Pen vs Hard Trax
item.description: Slam Inc Hard Kor’s EP “Pig Pen vs Hard” is a hard house track released in 2000 on Bangin Out Tunes, a sublabel of Alphamagic, a UK hard house/NRG label founded by TraxCalvin Sheppard and William Kimber.

item.title: Phil Stumpf – Stumpfam Apparat
item.description: A minimal track by Phil Stumpf, who is also a member of the German post-rock band ““OH.” and also active as the unit ““DUPLEX 100” with Sam Rouanet.

item.title: Phauna – Naturally (Remixes)
item.description: A deep house track released in 2003 on Canadian house label Play Records, founded by Mellee Fresh and DJ Spydabrown.

item.title: Partners In Kryme – Turtle Power
item.description: Partners in Kryme (Partnerz in Kryme) is a hip-hop duo from New York consisting of James Alpern and Richard Usher.

item.title: Para One – Midnight Swim
item.description: Para One is a French electronic producer. He is famous for producing the original soundtrack for the 2007 French film ““Water Lilies’’ (original title: Naissance Des Pieuvres).

item.title: On Top – Until I"m Heard
item.description: On Top is a garage trio consisting of Darrell Ellerbe, Julius James, and Sean Pennington.

item.title: O.C.U. – I"m All That (You"re My Everything)
item.description: O.C.U. (Organized Crime Unit) is a hip-hop trio from Chicago consisting of DJ Tragic (DJ, producer), Homicidal (MC), and Sudden Deff (MC).

item.title: NSM – Don"t Say It
item.description: NSM is the production name of Ian Grant, also known as IG Culture, an early innovator of Broken Beat.

item.title: Momo – Make Me Happy
item.description: A project record released in 2000 by PostPet’s pink bear “MOMO”. The producer is Ken Ishii.

item.title: Groove Man – Funky Peak No Limit
item.description: A house track released by Colombian DJ/producer Groove Man on the French house label Vector Records in 2005.

item.title: Gregorythme – Peter Pan Syndrome
item.description: Gregorythme ( Gregory Poncet (also known as Gregorism) is also active as a deep techno duo Digitaline with Laps. Since 2006, under the name Gregorythme, he has released works on labels such as Bruchstuecke, Minibar, Sushitech, Minimood, Rebirth, no19, and Cityfox.

item.title: Enzyme & Malice – Close Encounters Thru The Wormhole
item.description: A hardcore break track by hardcore break DJ/producers Enzyme and Malice.

item.title: Elvis Costello And The Attractions – Let Them All Talk
item.description: Elvis Costello was included in Rolling Stone’s list of the 100 Greatest Artists of All Time, and was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2003 as part of Elvis Costello and the Attractions.

item.title: El Cubano – Todos A La Fiesta Eo Eo Si Tu Quieres
item.description: Todos A La Fiesta/Eo Eo Si Tu Quieres by El Cubano is a Latin Eurohouse track released by the Italian label Muzic Without Control Records.

item.title: El Cubano – Samba Nueva
item.description: Samba Nueva by El Cubano is a Latin Eurohouse track released in 1998 on the Italian label Muzic Without Control Records.

item.title: Definition Of Sound – Moira Jane"s Café
item.description: Definition Of Sound is a London-based dance music group formed by Donald Weekes and Kevin Clark.

item.title: Dao Dezi – La Jument De Mishao
item.description: Dao Dezi is a project by Eric Mouquet and Guillain Joncheray of DEEP FOREST.

item.title: DNA – Rebel Woman
item.description: DNA is a duo of UK dance music producers Nick Batt and Neal Slateford.

item.title: DJ Antoine vs. Mad Mark Pres. The House Rockers – Reachin' 4 The Top
item.description: A house/garage house track by DJ Antoine & Madmark released in 2000 on Fresh Fruit Records, a Dutch house label founded by DJ Zki & Dobre.

item.title: Caesars – Jerk It Out (The Jason Nevins Remixes)
item.description: Jason Nevins, who is famous for remixing Run-D.M.C.’s “It’s Like That,” remixed “Jerk It Out” by Caesars, a Swedish indie rock band from Stockholm formed in 1995.

item.title: Blu Peter – The Pictures In Your Mind
item.description: Peter Harris, also known as Blu Peter, is a British electronic dance music producer and DJ from South Wales. In the early 1990s, he held a residency at the famous London clubs Heaven and Turnmills, and in the late 1990s he was active in the nu-NRG/Hard NRG scene.

item.title: B.E.F. Featuring Green Gartside – I Don't Know Why I Love You
item.description: B.E.F. (British Electric Foundation) is a group led by Ian Craig Marsh and Martyn Ware.

item.title: Atmosfear – Motivation (Dimitri From Paris Remixes)
item.description: A remix of Motivation by Atmosfear, a jazz-funk/Brit-funk band formed in England in 1978, by French house guru Dimitri From Paris.

item.title: Armand Van Helden – Koochy
item.description: “Koochy” was released in 2000 as the lead single from Armand Van Helden’s fourth studio album, Killing Puritans (2000).

item.title: Arling & Cameron – We Love To Rock
item.description: Arling & Cameron is a Dutch electronic music duo consisting of Gerry Arling and Richard Cameron.

item.title: Adam Kroll – Sylphen
item.description: An electro-tech house minimal track released in 2004 by Adam Kroll, known for his GODZILLA stuff, on the Cologne, Germany-based label Traum Schallplatten.

item.title: Access 58 – Collaborations & Remixes Volume 2
item.description: Access58 is a tech house production by Paulo Nascimento (AKA Urban Ritual) and Philippe Quenum.

item.title: Various – Totally Wired Nine
item.description: An acid jazz compilation album released in 1992 by the UK label Acid Jazz.

item.title: The Square – Stars And The Moon
item.description: THE SQUARE or T-SQUARE is a Japanese jazz fusion band formed in 1976.

item.title: The Count & Sinden Featuring Kid Sister – Beeper
item.description: Sinden & Count Of Monte Cristal is the duo of Graeme Sinden and Joshua Harvey.

item.title: Terry Brookes & Aaron Soul – City Life (Part 1)
item.description: City Life (Part 1) is a house track released in 2005 by Amsterdam-based Dutch record label Rush Hour, founded in 1999 by Christiaan Macdonald and Antal Heitlager.

item.title: Stoned Democracy – Close (Like An Overdose)
item.description: Stoned Democracy is a unit formed by Chris Rushby and Roland Armstrong (Rollo).

item.title: Stacs Of Stamina – Mistake Rewind Repeat EP
item.description: A glitch + UK garage + IDM + experimental track by Swedish electro hip-hop crew Stacs Of Stamina, released in 2005 on the UK independent label Werk Discs.

item.title: Pat McGlynn – She"d Rather Be With Me
item.description: Originally from Scotland, Pat McGlynn worked as a guitarist for the Bay City Rollers in late 1976 before forming his own band, Pat McGlynn’s Scotties.

item.title: Oi Polloi – Total Anarchoi
item.description: Oi Polloi is a punk rock (anarcho-punk) band formed in Scotland around 1981.

item.title: Laurent Garnier – Crispy Bacon (Part 2)
item.description: Laurent Garnier, also known as Choice, is a French electronic music producer and DJ.

item.description: “Rawcotiks – Yet Real Heads” was released in 1997 on Opposition Records.

item.title: RJD2 – Here"s What"s Left
item.description: RJD2 (Ramble Jon Krohn) is a US hip-hop/electronic producer and DJ. He is also active in groups such as Soul Position, MHz Legacy (MHz), and Icebird.

item.title: Peter Murphy – Should The World Fail To Fall Apart
item.description: Should the World Fail to Fall Apart is the debut album by British solo artist Peter Murphy, formerly a member of the gothic rock band Bauhaus.

item.description: Passage is a solo project by Louis Johnson, the bassist for the American soul/funk/jazz/disco band Brothers Johnson.

item.description: One Day As A Lion is a collaboration between Rage Against the Machine vocalist Zack de la Rocha and former drummer for The Mars Volta and current drummer for Queens of the Stone Age, Jon. A power duo supergroup formed in 2008 by Theodore (John Theodore).

item.title: Newton Family – Don Quijote
item.description: “Newton Family – Don Quijote” Newton Family was a Hungarian disco group that was active from the mid-70s to the late 80s.

item.title: Mr. Complex – Visualize Why Don"t Cha
item.description: Mr. Complex is a rapper based in Queens, New York. “Mr. Complex – Visualize / Why Don’t Cha” is produced by DJ Spinna, featuring Apani B. Fly, and Pharoahe Monch of Organized Konfusion.

item.title: Momoe Yamaguchi – Playback Part 2
item.description: “Momoe Yamaguchi – Playback Part 2” was released in 1978.

item.title: Michel Polnareff – Gift Pack Series
item.description: The Michel Polnareff – Gift Pack Series was released by Epic in 1973.

item.title: Megumi Asaoka – My boyfriend is left-handed
item.description: “Megumi Asaoka – My Boyfriend is Left-handed” was released in 1973.

item.description: “Masashi Sada – Nagasaki Sayokyoku” was released in 1982.

item.title: Jiro's –Peace Peace
item.description: “Jiro”s - Peace Peace - Children Who Don”t Know About War” was released in 1971.

item.title: Isao Sasaki – Farewell Space Battleship Yamato Warriors of Love – Good Enemy
item.description: “Isao Sasaki - Farewell Space Battleship Yamato: Warriors of Love - Good Enemy” is an insert song/image song for the 1978 movie “Farewell Space Battleship Yamato: Warriors of Love.”

item.title: Irene Cara – Fame
item.description: Irene Cara is an American singer and actress. She played the role of Coco Hernandez in the 1980 musical film ““Fame,” and the film’s title song ““Fame” became a worldwide hit.

item.title: Inner Circle – Black Roses
item.description: Inner Circle, also known as The Inner Circle Band or The Bad Boys of Reggae, is a Jamaican reggae band formed in Kingston in 1968.

item.title: Hiromi Go – Boys and Girls
item.description: “Hiromi Go – Boys and Girls” This is Hiromi Go’s first single (debut song) released in 1972.

item.title: Govna Matic – Family Day
item.description: Govna Matic is another name for Gov Matic (Tha Governer) from Diezzle Don & Tha Governer. This record features Redman, Pacewon, Roz, Runt Dog, Tame One, Young Zee, Commander Jesse, and more.

item.title: Frank Stallone - Far From Over
item.description: Frank Stallone is an American rock singer and younger brother of actor Sylvester Stallone.

item.title: Elvis Presley - You Don't Have To Say You Love Me
item.description: "”You Don”t Have To Say You Love Me” is originally an Italian song, with the original title ““I can”t live without you (Io che non vivo senza te)”. It was sung by Dusty Springfield and later covered by Elvis Presley.

item.title: Earth and Fire - Seasons
item.description: Earth & Fire is a pop-rock band from Voorchoten/Vorburg, the Netherlands. “Seasons”, released in 1969, is Earth & Fire’s signature song.

item.title: Earth Quake 198X
item.description: Bass: Nathan Watts

item.title: Down Town Boogie Woogie Band - Smoking Boogie
item.description: “Smoking Boogie” is The third single by the Down Town Boogie Woogie Band, released on the EXPRESS label in December 1974.

item.title: Deepswing – In The Music
item.description: Deep Swing is a duo of house producers Eric Wikman and James Donaldson from Los Angeles.

item.title: Calm – People From The Sun And The Earth
item.description: Calm (Kiyotaka Fukagawa) is considered one of the pioneers of chill-out Balearic music. Calm’s activities under other names include FARR, Organ Language, K.F, and the unit JAPANESE SYNCHRO SYSTEM with ILL-BOSSTINO of THA BLUE HERB.

item.title: Baruka – Play It Loud
item.description: Baruka is one of the projects of Dutch techno DJ/producer Orlando Voorn. Other names include Balance, Frequency, Basic Bastard, Fix, Dope Dog, Boy, Stalker, and The Nighttripper.

item.title: The Tigers – Smile For Me
item.description: “Smile For Me” is a song written and composed by Barry Gibb and Maurice Gibb of the Bee Gees.

item.title: The Rascals – People Got To Be Free My World
item.description: The Rascals are a blue-eyed soul band formed in New York in 1964. They released a series of hit songs from 1965 to 1969, and People Got To Be Free (Hymn to Freedom) is one of their hit songs and signature songs.

item.title: The Moody Brothers –Brown Eyed Girl Reggae Cowboy
item.description: The Moody Brothers were an Americana country music trio active in the 1980s and 1990s. The members are Carlton Moody, Dave Moody, and Trent Moody.

item.title: The Monkees - Words
item.description: The Monkees are an American rock band formed by Davy Jones, Micky Dolenz, Mike Nesmith, and Peter Tork. They had a media mix strategy that linked record sales with ““The Monkees Show,’’ a one-episode slapstick comedy TV show in which The Monkees themselves appeared.

item.title: The Folk Crusaders - I Only Live Twice
item.description: “Returning Yopparai” was the debut single by The Folk Crusaders and the first million-selling single in Oricon chart history. It is also the song that created the “underground folk” boom, and is a representative work of Japanese comic songs.

item.title: The Belle Stars–Iko Iko
item.description: The A-side, “Iko Iko,” is a cover song by The Belle Stars, a UK pop girl band formed in London in 1980 by former members of The Bodysnatchers.

item.title: The Bee Gees – Massachusetts
item.description: “Massachusetts” is a song released by the Bee Gees in 1967 that became a worldwide hit. The main vocalist of this song is Robin Gibb.

item.title: Talking Heads – And She Was
item.description: “And She Was” is a single cut from the US rock band Talking Heads’ sixth album “Little Creatures” released in 1985.

item.title: Shofukutei Tsuruko - Uguisudani Music Hall
item.description: “Uguisudani Music Hall” is a comic song released by Shofutei Tsurumitsu in May 1975.

item.title: Screamin Jay Hawkins – Constitution Blues
item.description: This song by Screamin’ Jay Hawkins was sung and performed by Screamin’ Jay Hawkins, an American blues singer known for his unique and unique style. He is known for his unique stage performances and powerful, harsh vocals.

item.title: Roy Montgomery – Particle Wave
item.description: Roy Montgomery is a composer and guitarist from Christchurch, New Zealand, and is known as a pioneer of the NZ underground.

item.title: Rosetta Stone – ROCK PICTURES
item.description: Rosetta Stone is a Northern Irish rock band formed by former Bay City Rollers guitarist Ian Mitchell.

item.title: Minor Tuning Band - Hit in Disco
item.description: The minor tuning band”s popular hit in disco “76 was released in 1976.

item.title: Lukie D Determine – Between The Sheets
item.description: “Between the Sheets” by The Isley Brothers is covered by Lukie D & Determine, singers representing the Jamaican dancehall scene.

item.title: Lisa Stansfield – All Around The World This Is The Right Time
item.description: Lisa Stansfield’s “All Around The World” is a UK R&B classic that became a worldwide hit.

item.title: Les Baxter His Chorus And Orchestra – Tamboo(Part 3)
item.description: This song by Les Baxter and his choir and orchestra appears on the album Tamboo!, released in 1956. Les Baxter is known for his unique exotic and sensual musical style, and his work pioneered genres such as exotica and space age pop.

item.title: Janet Jackson – Doesn"t Really Matter
item.description: “Doesn’t Really Matter” is the theme song for the 2000 film The Nutty Professor.

item.title: James Brown - It"s A Man"s Man's World
item.description: This song was written by James Brown and is known as one of his masterpieces. This song was released in 1966 and is considered a masterpiece of soul music with its powerful and emotional performance.

item.title: Genghis Khan – Moskau Rocking Son Of Dschinghis Khan
item.description: Genghis Khan was a West German group that was active worldwide from 1979 to 1985.

item.title: Economic Animals - Minato no Yoko
item.description: Economic Animals is a masked band led by Tsutomu Sasaki. “The Return of Minato no Yoko” was released in 1975 as a sequel and parody of “Minato no Yoko Yokohama Yokosuka” and an answer song.

item.title: Stock, Hausen & Walkman – Ventilating Deer
item.description: Stock, Hausen & Walkman (Stock, Hausen & Walkman) is a UK sampling collage music unit representing the 90s.

item.description: Smurf & Perry is a unit of German DJ Big Smurf (Frank Koopmann) and Fred Perry.

item.description: Smallage is a project by Italian DJ Stefano Mango, DJ Lino Lodi, and Denis Quarin.

item.description: Sexual Harrassment is an American project centered around DJ and producer Lynn Tolliver, Jr. (also known as David Payto).

item.title: Scooter – Call Me Mañana
item.description: Scooter is a happy hardcore rave techno music band founded in Hamburg, Germany in 1993.

item.title: Sandi & Matues – The World Pt. 1
item.description: The original version of “Sandi & Matues – The World Pt. 1” is a rare record that is rumored to only be owned by rare funk DJ KEB DARGE.

item.title: Rok – Silky
item.description: DJ Rok is a techno DJ from Germany. In the 90s, DJ Rok was the resident DJ at Berlin’s first acid house club, Ufo, and the first resident DJ at Tresor.

item.title: Repeater – The Serpents Knees E.P
item.description: Repeater is an acid techno unit composed of Alan Woodburn and Harold Walker. “The Serpents Knees E.P” was released by UK acid trance label Filterless.

item.title: Paintbox – The Door Provided Railroad
item.description: Paintbox’s 2nd 7 inch released in 1999 on the HG Fact label. Recorded at studio Our House.

item.title: PNAU – Wild Strawberries EP
item.description: PNAU is an Australian electronic dance music group formed by Nick Littlemore and Peter Mayes.

item.title: Özgür Can – Irony
item.description: Özgür Can is a producer and DJ from Sweden.

item.title: Orange 9mm – Orange 9mm
item.description: Orange 9mm is a US post-hardcore band formed by Chaka Malik and Chris Traynor in 1994 after the disbandment of New York hardcore band BURN.

item.title: No Artist – An Audio Obstacle Course - Shure Trackability Test Record
item.description: “No Artist – An Audio Obstacle Course – Shure Trackability Test Record” was released by Shure in 1967.

item.title: James Brown - Hustle!!! (Dead On It)
item.description: “Hustle!!! (Dead On It)” is a song from James Brown’s album “Dead On The Heavy Funk 1975-1983”.

item.description: Human Movement is a project by Marc Mitchell and Paul Mack from the Channel Islands (Jersey Island) in the UK.

item.description: “Impression Of Nasty Dread Best Of Hair-Style In My Life” by Hair Stylistics (Hair Stylistics a.k.a. Masaya Nakahara) is a 7-inch album released in 1999.

item.title: DSK – What Would We Do
item.description: “What Would We Do” is characterized by its catchy melody and rhythm. In particular, vocal loops and electronic sounds set the tone for the song.

item.title: Cactus World News – Live
item.description: This album is a live recording of a concert held at The Whiskey in Los Angeles on August 20, 1986.

item.title: Boris Dlugosch – Bionic Breaks
item.description: Boris Dlugosch is a house DJ and producer based in Hamburg.

item.description: A compilation released in 1998 on Müller Records, a techno and electro label run by German DJ and producer Frank Müller. Featuring DJ Rok, DJ Disko, Jonzon, and Beroshima.

item.title: VA – Thank God It"s Friday
item.description: “VA - Thank God It’s Friday” was released by Casablanca in 1978.

item.title: Trancesetters – Secrets Of Meditation Neurodisco
item.description: Trancesetters is a project by Gaston Steenkist and Alex Dijksterhuis. The remix was created by SHITAKE and Billy Nasty, who heads the label Zoom Records, and David Wesson.

item.title: Tomita – The Planets
item.description: Isao Tomita is a Japanese composer and electronic music pioneer.

item.title: Tomita – Cosmos
item.description: “Cosmos” is one of Isao Tomita’s musical works related to space.It was composed by combining science and music to express the mystery and grandeur of the universe, making full use of electronic music and synthesizers to musically express the image of the universe.

item.title: Squeeze – Babylon And On
item.description: “Babylon and On” is an album released in 1987 by the British band “Squeeze”.

item.title: Snake Thing – Blizzard Of Ooze Anything Could Happen
item.description: Snake Thing is Nick Taylor’s solo project.

item.title: Slab – Freeky Speed
item.description: Slab is a unit formed by Lol Hammond and Nina Walsh.

item.title: Scarfo – Scarfo
item.description: Scarfo is a British rock band formed in 1994 by Jamie Hince, Nick Prior, and Al Saunders.

item.title: Saturnalia – Greenpeace Release
item.description: Saturnalia is the project of UK producers Jim Sullivan and Steve McGarrigle. All profits from this release were donated to Greenpeace.

item.title: Rossington Collins Band – Anytime Anyplace Anywhere
item.description: Anytime, Anyplace, Anywhere is the Rossington Collins Band”s first studio album, released in 1980, and includes their signature song, ““Don”t Misunderstand Me.’’

item.title: Rednail Kidz – Elektrik Disko
item.description: Rednail Kidz is a US deep house production duo consisting of DJ/producer Derrick Carter and Chris Nazuka, who have been active since the early 80’s Chicago house.

item.title: Mark Tower & Co. – My Desire
item.description: Composed by Giuliano Crivellente, Mauro Farina. The vocalist is Gianni Coraini (also known as Ken Laszlo, DJ NRG, and many others).

item.description: Dylan is the alias of breakbeat, techno, and electro producer Dylan Rhymes. “Society/Revolver” was released in 2000 on Dylan Rhymes’ own label Blue Black.

item.title: DSK – Work My Body Over (Sweat)
item.description: DSK is a house dance music project created by the Hot Productions team of Davis-Stone-Klein (Larry Davis, Joe Stone, Paul Klein).

item.title: Commander Tom – Eye Bee M
item.description: Commander Tom is a techno DJ and producer from Germany. “Eye Bee M” is one of Commander Tom”s signature songs. The B-side is a song featuring Mars, known for San Francisco”s cybertrance pioneers Mars & Mystre.

item.title: Bullblast – Inch By Inch
item.description: BULLBLAST is a unit composed of TARO KAWAUCHI and K-SOBAJIMA. “Inch By Inch” was released in 2006 by Nitelist Music, a label founded by DJ Emma and Taro Kawauchi in 2000.

item.title: Arti$try – The Worker
item.description: Arti$try is a unit formed by Marco Verkuylen and Benjamin Kuyten. “Arti$try – The Worker” was released in 1998 on the Dutch house label Fresh Fruit Records.

item.title: Archae and Grovskopa – Emergent Properties
item.description: Archae & Grovskopa are the Swedish techno duo of Benny Liberg (Archae) and Mika Hallbäck (Grovskopa).

item.title: Alphaville – Romeos
item.description: Alphaville is a German synth pop band led by Marian Gold, formed in 1982.

item.title: Wink – Higher State Of Consciousness
item.description: Josh Wink, also known as Wink, is an electronic dance music DJ/producer/remixer from Philadelphia, US. Wink was a pioneering DJ in the American rave scene in the early 1990s, and “Higher State Of Consciousness” is one of his signature songs.

item.title: Various – Electro Swing
item.description: “Various – Electro Swing” was released by Wagram Music in 2009.

item.title: The Architect – Pixelated Porn King
item.description: The Architect is the alias of DJ/producer Jay Haze. There are also Fuckpony, Sub Version, etc. Jay Haze is responsible for collaborations with Ricardo Villalobos and Samim Winiger, as well as remixes for Hell, P. Diddy, Gui Boratto, and more. Among his remixes, Yann Tiersen’s theme to the movie Amélie became a crossover hit.

item.title: Soul Central Feat. Kathy Brown – Strings Of Life (Stronger On My Own)
item.description: Soul Central remake of Derrick May’s “Strings Of Life” released in 1987. Soul Central is a UK music duo consisting of Andy Ward and Paul Timothy. Featuring house vocalist Kathy Brown from South Carolina.

item.title: Quincy Jones – Body Heat
item.description: Body Heat is an album released by Quincy Jones in 1974.

item.title: Milk Inc. – Run
item.description: Milk Inc. is a Belgian dance band founded in the mid-90s as a studio project led by Belgian musician/producer/DJ Regi Penxten.

item.title: Mauro Picotto – Lizard
item.description: Mauro Picotto is an Italian producer and DJ who has been active since the early 1990s. He has collaborated with numerous electronica/trance musicians such as DJ Tiësto and Mario Piu. “Lizard” is one of Mauro Picotto’s signature songs, released by Empire State Records in 1998.

item.title: Linoleum Lineage DJ Rylo and Omanjamari – Holes After Dark EP
item.description: Linoleum Lineage is a unit formed by LA-based beatmaker DJ Rylo and MC Omanjamari.

item.title: Lemare – Good Times
item.description: “Good Times” is “Good Times” by British R&B artist LEMARE (Lemar Obika) was released in 1998.

item.title: Kagami – Guardians Hammer
item.description: “Kagami – Guardians Hammer” was released in 2008 on the techno/disco/house label Carizma.

item.title: Judson J. Eiloart – Heaven & Hell
item.description: Judson J. Eiloart, also known as the Distortion Orchestra, is a guitarist and music producer from Manchester, England who is active in the psychedelic underground of northern UK.

item.title: Ito & Star – Sudoko Kid
item.description: “Ito & Star – Sudoko Kid” is a minimal techno song by Ito (Itamar Levy) and Star (Ophir Star) released in 2007 by Cr2 Records.

item.title: Grant Nelson – Spellbound
item.description: Grant Nelson is a producer, remixer, and DJ from London who released numerous club hits on the label Nice ‘N” Ripe in the mid-90s and influenced the UK garage scene. In the late 1990s, he was active in the “2-Step” Garage scene, releasing songs such as a remix of James Brown”s “Funk On Ah Roll.”

item.title: DJ Omega – Spellbound
item.description: DJ Omega (Will Simpson) is an electronic music producer from Detroit. Mixed by DJ/producer DJ Godfather (Brian Jeffries) from Detroit.

item.title: DJ Guy – Incendiary EP
item.description: DJ Guy is a London-based DJ and producer and owner of the Global Fire label, which specializes in Detroit booty and Chicago Ghetto House.

item.title: Cássia Eller – Participaçāo Especial
item.description: A collection of duets by Kasia Herrere and famous artists of MPB and Brazilian pop. It was released in 2002, after her death.

item.title: Asian Dub Foundation – Tank
item.description: “Tank” is AsianDubFoundation’s fifth album. This album featured vocals from Ghetto Priest, with the help of dub music producer Adrian Sherwood.

item.title: Anton Pieete – Players
item.description: Anton Pieete is a DJ/producer from Amsterdam. “Players” is one of Anton Pieete”s signature songs and was released in 2008 on Intacto Records, one of Planet Gong”s sub-labels.

item.title: Alfred Azzetto – Colors (Part One)
item.description: Alfred Azzetto is a house music producer and DJ. He is also famous as the producer of DB Boulevard, whose 2002 release “Point of View” became a worldwide hit.

item.title: Absolum – Regenerate D-Generate
item.description: Absolum is the alias of French psytrance artist Christof Drouillet.

item.title: Yumi Matsutoya – Da・Di・Da
item.description: “DA・DI・DA” is Yumi Matsutoya’s 17th original album released in 1985.

item.title: Unknown Artist – Get Deep
item.description: A mashup of Roland Clark”s “I Get Deep,” Carl Craig”s “Just Another Day,” and Carl Craig”s alias Paperclip People”s “remake,” which samples Manuel Göttsching’s “E2-E4.” Edited by Timmy Regisford.

item.title: Southern All Stars - Stereo Taiyo-Zoku
item.description: “Stereo Taiyozoku” is the fourth original album by Southern All Stars. Original version from 1981.

item.title: Roberto Rodriguez – Moonraker Serenade EP
item.description: Roberto Rodriguez is a Finnish DJ/producer and founder of the Serenades label. Roberto Rodriguez has released a number of house classics, including “Mustat Varjot,” a staple of DJ Harvey’s sets.

item.title: Quench – Dreams
item.description: Christopher J. Dolan (CJ Dolan), also known as Quench, is an Australian dance music producer and musician. “Quench – Dreams” became a worldwide hit. Co-producer: Sean Quinn.

item.title: Norma Sheffield – Look Me In The Eyes
item.description: Norma Sheffield is an Italian Eurobeat project. Her public personality is Francesca Contini, who also worked as a composer. (Francesca Contini), but the vocals were performed by Chiara De Pieri.

item.title: Michael Saxell – Red And Blue
item.description: Michael Saxell is a Swedish singer-songwriter/composer/lyricist/multi-instrumentalist/producer.

item.title: MK – Burning
item.description: MK (Marc Kinchen) is a music producer/DJ/remixer from Detroit. “Burning” is one of MK’s masterpieces.

item.title: Kierra Sheard – Just Until
item.description: Kierra Kiki Sheard is a gospel singer from Detroit, US. In Japan, it is known as KiKi. Her mother is Karen Clark Sheard of the gospel legend, the Clark Sisters.

item.title: Invitation To Denon PCM (A Magnificient New Recording System)
item.description: “Invitation To Denon PCM (A Magnificient New Recording System)” was released by Denon in 1975.

item.title: Don Dixon – Romeo At Juilliard
item.description: Don Dixon is an American producer/songwriter/musician. In the 1970s, he was active in the North Carolina rock band Arrogance, and from the 1980s he produced a number of indie bands, and was also involved in producing the US alternative rock band R.E.M.

item.title: Debra Dolce – Goodies
item.description: “Goodies” is This is an EP by Debra Dolce released in 2008 by the label “Coco Machete Records”.

item.title: Cut & Run – Outta Space 6,4367
item.description: “Outta Space 6,4367” samples The Prodigy’s “Out Of Space.”

item.title: Chris Punk – Lady Vs. Country Girl
item.description: A house remix of Primal Scream”s “Country Girl” and Modjo”s “Lady (Hear Me Tonight)” by Chris Punk, who has remixed many club hits.

item.title: C-Mos – 2 Million Ways
item.description: C-Mos is the alias of Belgian DJ Olivier Abbeloos.

item.title: Anthony Vieira – Merino EP
item.description: Anthony Vieira is a unit formed by Raoul Delgardo and Tony Soares Vieira. “Anthony Vieira – Merino EP” was released in 1999 by the UK techno label Sheep Records.

item.title: Adam Marshall – Remote Culture
item.description: Adam Marshall is a Canadian-born DJ/producer and owner of the label New Kanada, currently based in Berlin. Also active as a unit called Graze with Christian Andersen.

item.title: Adam Beyer – Tasty Bits
item.description: A two-disc set released in 1997 by the label Drumcode run by Swedish techno DJ/producer Adam Beyer, who was a central figure in the Swedish minimal techno scene in the late 1990s.

item.title: Adam Beyer – Drumcode 09
item.description: Swedish techno DJ/producer Adam Beyer, who was a central figure in the Swedish minimal techno scene in the late 90s, released this techno track that symbolizes this era in 1997 on his own label Drumcode.

item.title: AC/DC – Flick Of The Switch
item.description: Flick of the Switch is the ninth studio album by Australian hard rock band AC/DC.

item.title: Various – King Britt Presents Black To The Future
item.description: A compilation by King Britt, a key figure in the Philadelphia house scene.

item.title: The Spudmonsters – No Guarantees
item.description: The Spudmonsters are an American thrash metal, hardcore, crossover band formed in 1987 by Don Foose, Scott Roberts, Steve Swanson, Eric Matthews, and Chris Andrews from Cleveland, Ohio.

item.title: Sasha vs. Underworld – Cowpander
item.description: A mashup of Underworld “Cowgirl” and Sasha “Xpander” by Junkie XL.

item.title: Queen – Sheer Heart Attack
item.description: “Sheer Heart Attack” is Queen’s third album. Produced by Queen and Roy Thomas Baker. It was also from this album that songs written by John Deacon began to be included.

item.title: Play – Every Little Step / Ain't No Mountain High Enough
item.description: A Swedish pop girl group formed in 2001.

item.title: Oliver Ho – The Ancestors (Remixes)
item.description: Oliver Ho is a London-based DJ/producer. “The Ancestors (Remixes)” was released in 2002 by Fine Audio Recordings, a German techno label specializing in hard minimal techno.

item.title: O.L. – Feinmechanik Knochenbrecher
item.description: O.L. is the alias of Oliver Lieb, who was a central figure in German trance techno in the early 1990s. Oliver Lieb works under a number of aliases, including Spicelab, LSG, and Ambush.

item.title: Moby – Why Does My Heart Feel So Bad
item.description: A remix of “Moby – Why Does My Heart Feel So Bad?” released in 1999 on the UK label Mute. Side A is a remix by German DJ/producer ATB (Andre Tanneberger).

item.title: Justin Berkovi – I Can Feel The Sound
item.description: Justin Berkovi is a London-based techno DJ/producer and founder of Predicaments. Additionally, Justin Berkovi is participating in the music and visual art group NO FUTURE, which is led by Christian Vogel, along with Si Begg, Jamie Lidell, and others.

item.title: Holy Moses – Queen Of Siam
item.description: Holy Moses is a German thrash metal band that has been active since 1980. The front is Sabina Classen. Known as a pioneering group of female death voice vocalists.

item.title: Grand Funk – The Best Of Grand Funk
item.description: Grand Funk Railroad (GFR) is an American hard rock band. The core members are Mark Furner, Mel Thatcher, and Don Brewer.

item.title: Funkis – Sweden-Kalmar-Funkabo
item.description: Funkis is a unit formed by Dan Fun and Nikolas Rowland. “Sweden-Kalmar-Funkabo” was released in 1997 by Sweden’s Weber Börft Records.

item.title: Dr. Hook – Sexy Eyes
item.description: Dr. Hook is an American rock band from New Jersey. In 1975, the name was changed from Dr. Hook & The Medicine Sho to Dr. Hook. The producer is Ron Haffkine, a US record producer/composer and manager of Dr. Hook & The Medicine Sho.

item.title: Depth Charge – Depth Charge
item.description: Depth Charge is the alias of British DJ/musician J.Saul Kane, who has also released under various other names, including The Octagon Man, Alexander’s Dark Band, T.E.T, and Grimm Death. J Saul Kane is also the owner of DC Recordings and Electron Industries.

item.title: Deodato – Deodato 2
item.description: Eumir Deodato, also known as Deodato, is a Brazilian musician, composer, arranger, and producer.

item.description: 2 The Core is a Eurohouse group formed by Dutch dance music record producers Michiel van der Kuy and Nick Name.

item.description: Released in 1997 on the Strictly Rhythm label, ““Ultra Naté – Free’’ is considered one of the dance anthems of the 90s.

item.description: The Art Of Trance is the alias of UK trance music artist Simon Berry. Also known as Poltergeist and Vicious Circles. Simon Berry is also a member of the trance groups Clanger, Conscious and Union Jack.

item.description: “Magical Express” is a trance track by trance DJ/producer ORIENTAL SPACE, a pioneer of the Japanese dance scene, released by the label Farm Records in 2003. Promo board.

item.description: Released in 1973, the album Bongo Rock by the instrumental funk band Michael Viner’s Incredible Bongo Band incorporated elements of funk, soul, and breakbeat, and was later sampled by numerous artists in the hip-hop and breakbeat scenes.

item.description: Oliver Lieb, also known as LSG, was a central figure in the German trance techno scene in the early 1990s. Other names include Spicelab, LSG, and Ambush.

The band”s unique style, which combines a powerful rock sound and catchy melody with reggae rhythms and punk elements, and vocalist Benji Webbe”s distinctive singing voice and expressiveness made a strong impression on the band’s music.

item.title: Yellowman – Rambo
item.description: “Rambo” is a song by Jamaican reggae musician Yellowman. Yellowman was a very popular artist in Jamaican music in the 1980s.

item.title: Yellowman & General Trees – A Reggae Calypso Encounter
item.description: Yellowman is a very popular dancehall reggae artist in the Jamaican music scene, and General Trees is a similarly well-known dancehall artist. Their collaboration ““A Reggae Calypso Encounter’’ offers a unique sound that combines elements of Jamaican reggae and Trinidad and Tobago calypso.

item.title: U2 – The Joshua Tree
item.description: "”The Joshua Tree”’ was inspired by Joshua Tree National Park, a desert area in the southwestern United States. The album develops U2”s unique musical style while exploring religious themes and political messages. Fusing elements of rock, pop, blues, and folk, it features epic soundscapes and emotional lyrics.

item.title: U2 – October
item.description: “October” was U2’s second album, and it marked the maturation and development of their music. The album explores human suffering and faith, with a focus on religious themes. Musically, it combines elements of rock, post-punk, and art rock, with emotional lyrics and a unique sound.

item.title: U2 – Achtung Baby
item.description: Achtung Baby is an album in which U2 explores a new musical direction, attempting to deconstruct and reinvent their traditional sound. The album explores new expressions while incorporating electronic elements and dance music influences while retaining U2’s signature melodies and emotional lyrics.

item.title: The Beatles – Revolver
item.description: A notable song on “Revolver” is “Eleanor Rigby.” This heartwarming song features a string octet and showcases Paul McCartney’s storytelling talent.

item.title: Talking Heads – Little Creatures
item.description: "”Little Creatures”’ represents one of the musical evolutions of Talking Heads. The album incorporates pop elements into the band”s sound and is full of melodic and catchy songs. This allowed their music to appeal to a wider audience.

item.title: Suicidal Tendencies – Lights...Camera...Revolution
item.description: "”Lights…Camera…Revolution!’’ is a seminal work in Suicidal Tendencies” career, embodying the breadth and energy of their music. The album is characterized by intense guitar riffs, speedy drums, and Mike Muir”s powerful vocals.

item.title: Stevie Wonder – Hotter Than July
item.description: “Hotter Than July” includes many hit songs, most notably “Master Blaster (Jammin”)” and “Happy Birthday.” In particular, “Happy Birthday” was created as a song to celebrate Martin Luther King Jr.”s birthday, and became a symbol of the American civil rights movement.

item.title: Squeeze – Babylon And On
item.description: This album “Babylon And On” by Squeeze was produced by Eric “ET” Thorngren and Glenn Tilbrook.

item.title: Sly & The Family Stone – Stand
item.description: “Stand!” is Sly & the Family Stone’s fourth studio album and one of their most successful works.

item.title: Run-D.M.C. – King Of Rock
item.description: “King of Rock” is Run-DMC”s second studio album, and it became a work that further increased the band”s popularity. The album features hard beats, powerful rhythms, and Run-DMC’s unique rap style. Their music reflected street culture and youth sensibilities, and their energy and aggressive style made a strong impression on many listeners.

item.title: Public Enemy – Apocalypse 91... The Enemy Strikes Black
item.description: "”Apocalypse 91… The Enemy Strikes Black” follows the success of their previous album ““Fear of a Black Planet.” The album’s title conveys the message of “continuing the fight against black rights and social inequality.”

item.title: Parliament – ​​Up For The Down Stroke
item.description: “Up for the Down Stroke” is Parliament’s first studio album, and its sound is characterized by an energetic, danceable funk beat. The album is filled with groovy songs that incorporate elements of funk.

item.title: Lou Reed – New York
item.description: “New York” is an important album in Lou Reed”s career and focuses on his hometown of New York. The album”s lyrics reflect the reality of New York City and social issues. Featuring Lou Reed’s sharp poetry and his own unique vocal style, it depicts the darkness and light of the city from his perspective.

item.title: Led Zeppelin – Led Zeppelin II
item.description: “Led Zeppelin II” is a further evolution of the band”s sound, and contains hard, energetic songs. The album features performances that highlight the talents of each member, including Jimmy Page”s guitar riffs, Robert Plant”s vocals, John Bonham”s drums, and John Paul Jones’ bass.

item.title: Isaac Hayes – Shaft
item.description: It was created as the soundtrack for the movie Shaft, and is responsible for the music for the classic blaxploitation crime film directed by Gordon Parks. This album was critically acclaimed and considered one of the greatest soundtracks of all time.

item.title: Funkadelic – Standing On The Verge Of Getting It On
item.description: “Standing on the Verge of Getting It On” is an album by the American funk band Funkadelic. This album was released in 1974. Funkadelic is a group led by George Clinton, and their music is known for its psychedelic funk sound and experimental approach.

item.title: Funkadelic – Let's Take It To The Stage

item.description: “Kernkraft 400” (German: Kernkraft 400) is a song released by the German techno group Zombie Nation, and is the first single released from their album “Leichenschmaus”. Released in 1999, it peaked at number 22 in Germany in February 2000. It reached the top 10 in Belgium and the Netherlands, and debuted at number 2 in the UK, selling over 400,000 copies and receiving a gold disc certification from the British Recording Industry Association.

The synth riff then returns, leading into a powerful chorus. The second breakdown is even more detailed, with the return of the tasteful piano and lead synth with a more sophisticated melody.

item.title: The Beatnuts –World Famous Classics 1993-1998

item.title: The Beatnuts – Take It Or Squeeze It
item.description: “The Beatnuts – Take It Or Squeeze It” is the fourth studio album by the hip hop group The Beatnuts. Released in 2001, this album showcases The Beatnuts’ signature production style and witty lyrics.

item.title: Sven Vath – Fusion
item.description: “Sven Väth - Fusion” is an album by German techno DJ and producer Sven Väth. He is a very important figure in the techno music scene and has had a long and successful career.

item.description: Rodrigo y Gabriela is a guitar duo from Mexico.

item.description: This is the mixtape “Super Disco Breaks Volumes 1-4” by Muro.

item.description: “Jungllenium Remixes” is a collection of remixes of Jungle Brothers’ songs by various producers and remixers.

item.description: “Heart of Darkness” is a song that stands out among Fudrum Priest’s works. Hudrum Priest is the project of UK musician Derek Thompson. His music is experimental, incorporating elements from various genres, and is characterized by dark atmospheres and experimental soundscapes.

item.description: This album is a collaboration between Brazilian bossa nova singer João Gilberto and American tenor saxophonist Stanley Turrentine.

item.description: The track was originally produced in 1994 and pressed on vinyl in 2015. “Josie”s Jungle” is an alternate version of the track that originally appeared on Jet Star, with the Blackstreet sample replaced with Sugar Minott”s “Herbman Hustling.”

item.description: “DMX Krew” is a project by British electronic music artist Edward Upton.

item.description: Autechre is a British techno unit consisting of Sean Booth and Rob Brown.

item.description: “Audio Active – Return Of The Red I” is an album by the Japanese music group Audio Active. This album was released in 1999.

item.description: “Accept – Russian Roulette” is an album by the German heavy metal band Accept. This album is the band’s seventh studio album, released in 1986.

item.description: “Various – Pride ‘99 Sampler” is a rare promo tape released by the US label Wherehouse Music in 1999.

item.description: I Am Ready EP is an EP by Umek, a techno DJ and producer from Slovenia.

item.description: Polyester is a project by Bernard Garcia with Bruno Quartier and Etienne Vandeveer.

item.title: Pike's Peak – All Around My City
item.description: “All Around My City” is This is a record by Pike’s Peak, a punk ska band from Hiroshima, released in 1999.

item.title: New Order – Someone Like You
item.description: “Someone Like You” is included on New Order”s 2015 album “Music Complete,” and is a song that combines pop and electronic elements, highlighting New Order”s signature sound of synthesizers and dance beats.

item.title: Mr. Joshua Presents Espiritu –In Praise Of The Sun
item.description: This is a popular two-disc set released in 2002 by Mr. Joshua, a unit of Brian Higgins and Nick Coler.

item.title: Miss Monday – Curious
item.description: “Curious” is one of Japanese singer-songwriter Miss Mandy’s signature songs. She specializes in pop music that incorporates elements of jazz and soul, and is known for her powerful vocals and emotional expression.

item.description: “Will You Be There” is from American pop music icon Michael Jackson’s 1991 album Dangerous.

item.description: “The Only Rhyme That Bites 99” is a remake of the song “The Only Rhyme That Bites”, released in 1990 by British hip-hop artist MC Tunes and electronic music group 808 State.

item.title: Love And Rockets – Love And Rockets
item.description: Love And Rockets - Love And Rockets is a self-titled album by British alternative rock band Love And Rockets. Love and Rockets was formed by former Bauhaus members Daniel Asch, David Jay, and Kevin Haskins.

item.title: Kissogram / 33HZ – My Friend Is A Seahorse / Hot Flashes
item.description: “My Friend Is A Seahorse / Hot Flashes” is a song co-produced by Kissogram and 33HZ. Kissogram is a German electronic music duo and 33HZ is an American electronic pop band.

item.title: Janet Jackson – Doesn"t Really Matter
item.description: “Doesn”t Really Matter” is a song created as the soundtrack for the movie “The Nutty Professor 2.” The song features an uptempo, pop sound and catchy melody, and Janet Jackson”s dynamic vocals stand out.

item.title: India Arie – Heading In The Right Direction
item.description: “Heading In The Right Direction” is one of the masterpieces of American singer-songwriter India Arie. She is known for her musical style, which incorporates elements of soul and R&B, and is known for her sincere singing and heartfelt lyrics.

item.title: Earth, Wind & Fire – Heritage
item.description: “Heritage” appears on Earth, Wind & Fire”s 1980 album Faces. The song has a sound that blends the band”s signature funk, soul, disco, and pop elements.

item.description: “Symphonium” is a techno track produced by Drivetrain, an artist active in the Detroit techno scene.

item.description: “Let Me Ride” is a song from Dr. Dre’s debut solo album, The Chronic, released in 1992.

item.description: “Some Great Reward” is a 1984 album by Depeche Mode and their fourth studio album. This album is one of the seminal works in the band’s career, showing the evolution and maturation of their sound.

item.title: Denki Groove – Dragon EP
item.description: The title song “Dragon” is a danceable song that combines elements of electronic music and techno. Denki Groove is characterized by its unique sound and rhythm, and its unique melody and beat captivate listeners.

item.title: Cursor Miner – Remote Control
item.description: Cursor Miner is a project by Rob Tubb (real name Rob Tubb).

item.description: This is an EP by Co-Fusion released on the UK label Pro-Jex in 2001.

item.description: “Hebula” is a great psychedelic tribal techno song. I”m not sure why this track isn”t on the Anima:Beat album, but it sounds like it stands out from the rest of the album.

item.description: “Moneytalks” is a song from AC/DC’s 1990 album The Razors Edge.

item.description: This is a 10-inch record by Brian Girgus, Matthew Troy, and Wyatt Cusick”s band Track Star, released in 1995 by San Diego”s Silver Girl Records.

item.description: “Now That I”m Free” is a song by French trio Outlines and RZA (Wu-Tang Clan). In addition to the groovy rhythm and attractive melody, this song features Outlines and RZA”s vocal performance with a positive message about liberation and freedom.

item.description: M.I.A. is a British singer-songwriter, rapper, and producer known for his unique musical style that incorporates political messages and sampling.

The remixer includes the participation of famous domestic and international artists and creators, and contains songs that add new interpretations and arrangements to Denki Groove”s music.

item.description: It deserves a top collection among Razomaid remixes. The highlight of this double-pack LP is “The Walk” by The Cure.

item.title: Quarks – Allein
item.description: Quarks, an electro-pop duo from Berlin, Germany, was formed in 1995 and consists of Gudrun Gut and Thomas Fehlmann. They became popular in the German electronic music scene in the late 1990s and early 2000s.

item.title: Ol' Dirty Bastard – Return To The 36 Chambers The Dirty Version
item.description: This album, ““Return To The 36 Chambers The Dirty Version,’’ is one of the most successful releases of Ol” Dirty Bastard”s solo career.

item.title: Dance Hall Crashers – THE OLD RECORD (1989-1992)
item.description: DANCE HALL CRASHERS is an American ska-core band formed in Berkeley, California in 1989.

item.title: Lauryn Hill – Doo Wop (That Thing) / Lost Ones
item.description: “Lauryn Hill - Doo Wop (That Thing) / Lost Ones” is a song by American singer-songwriter Lauryn Hill. The song was released as a single from her debut solo album, The Miseducation of Lauryn Hill (1998).

item.title: Mondo Grosso – Now You Know Better
item.description: “Now You Know Better” by Mondo Grosso (Shinichi Osawa) is an EP released in 2000.

item.title: Classified – Union Dues Promo 12-2
item.description: Classified Classified (real name: Luke Donald Boyd)’s Union Dues Promo 12-2 was released in 2002 on the label HalfLife Records.

item.title: Whitney Houston & Enrique Iglesias – Could I Have This Kiss Forever
item.description: “Whitney Houston & Enrique Iglesias - Could I Have This Kiss Forever” is a collaboration song between American singer Whitney Houston and Spanish singer Enrique Iglesias. This song appears on Whitney Houston’s album ““Whitney: The Greatest Hits” (2000) and Enrique Iglesias’ album ““Enrique” (1999).

item.title: Buffalo Daughter – WXBD
item.description: “Buffalo Daughter - WXBD” is an album by Japanese experimental rock band Buffalo Daughter.
